commit_message:
Render hidden stack parameters with a password field

In the launch stack form, any heat template parameters that are
of type string and marked as hidden are now rendered as a
password field.

Change-Id: Ie9b0a051a8815525c89de31b7ab98d8148166a55
Closes-Bug: 1362846

subject: ModelsMigrationsSync:Override compare_server_default
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-19 07:47:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ModelsMigrationsSync:Override compare_server_default for MySQL

This test showed an error with alembic 0.6.6:
Integer server_default value is compared incorrectly.
For example, when model has DefaultClause('0', for_update=False)
alembic finds it different from server variant "'0'".

Such error appear in implementation of ModelsMigrationsSync to Neutron
https://review.openstack.org/76520.

Change-Id: I9730da1c0790a88f81570c51c36cc0cbe0651a5a
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-20 09:14:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ModelsMigrationsSync:Override compare_server_default

For example, when model has DefaultClause('0', for_update=False)
alembic finds it different from server variant "'0'".
For PostgreSQL Sting server_default value is compared incorrectly.

commit_message:
ModelsMigrationsSync:Override compare_server_default

This test showed an error with alembic 0.6.6:
For MySQL Integer server_default value is compared incorrectly.
For example, when model has DefaultClause('0', for_update=False)
alembic finds it different from server variant "'0'".
For PostgreSQL Sting server_default value is compared incorrectly.
For example, when model has DefaultClause('', for_update=False)
alembic finds it different from server variant "''::character varying".

Such error appear in implementation of ModelsMigrationsSync to Neutron
https://review.openstack.org/76520.

Change-Id: I9730da1c0790a88f81570c51c36cc0cbe0651a5a

commit_message:
Convert v3 servers return_reservation_id behaviour to v2.1

Changes return reservation id format on server create to
the v2.1 format.

Adds api sample tests for the os-multiple-create plugin

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I148cce80fb4b19a4240e00ca206fcb7bac20f357

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-04 04:40:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix version number to unblock gate

We need to update the version number in setup.cfg, otherwise pbr will

ValueError: git history requires a target version of

commit_message:
Fix version number to Juno

We need to update the version number in setup.cfg, otherwise pbr will
fail with:
"error in setup command: Error parsing /opt/stack/new/manila/setup.cfg:
ValueError: git history requires a target version of
pbr.version.SemanticVersion(2014.2.0.0b4), but target version is
pbr.version.SemanticVersion(2013.2.0)"

Change-Id: I608c1dce0169fe78667e5818f2abff3dc8b11447

subject: display flavor details on database launch
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-03 15:05:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/databases/templates/databases/_launch_details_help.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/databases/templates/databases/_flavors.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/databases/workflows/create_instance.py'], 'message': 'display flavor details on database launch

The modal for creating instance of a database has a flavor dropdown
but it is not clear what the properties of the flavor are. This
patch follows the same convention used in the Launch Instance under
the instances panel. It displays the Flavor Details in a table
under the help section for the flavor selected.

Change-Id: I9ce6d3aa3db3973c5e10a041467d569db328f5b9
Closes-Bug: #1360012
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
display flavor details on database launch

The modal for creating instance of a database has a flavor dropdown
but it is not clear what the properties of the flavor are. This
patch follows the same convention used in the Launch Instance under
the instances panel. It displays the Flavor Details in a table
under the help section for the flavor selected.

Change-Id: I9ce6d3aa3db3973c5e10a041467d569db328f5b9
Closes-Bug: #1360012

commit_message:
Enable H301, H304 hacking rules

Reasons:
 - H301 should be enabled to avoid multiple imports per single line;
 - H304(enabled by H301) should be enabled to avoid relative imports.

Changes:
 - ignoring H302(import only modules) because it appears
   to checked when H301 was enabled;
 - H303 wasn`t added to `ignore` list because
   Trove code doesn't have those violations;
 - tox.ini updated

Change-Id: Iaeaaf7e5266aded896efdefc1b4436861a54f835
Closes-Bug: #1337409

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-30 17:55:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'vmwareapi oslo vmware library integration

These are changes necessary to integrate the vmwareapi driver with the oslo
common vmwareapi code. Much of the change is stripping out code obsoleted by
the oslo code.

Effort was made to minimize the amount of actual driver code changes in this
round by keeping a small amount of shim code. Existing unit tests were modified
as appropriate. Additional patches will be introduced shortly to include
additional conversions and tests.

Summary of changes:

- use common/vmware/exceptions.py - there are a linger bit of code (most
  for defining nova-specific exceptions that are still retained in
  error_util.py)
- use common/vmware/vim.py for the Vim implemenation
- use common/vmware/api.py for api session
- updated existing unit tests
- nova retains its own version of get_{soap/wsdl}_url which using conf
  settings for default and overrides.

Effort was made to minimize the amount of actual driver code changes in
this round by keeping a small amount of shim code. Existing unit tests
were modified as appropriate. Additional patches will be introduced
shortly to include additional conversions and tests.

Summary of changes:

- use common/vmware/exceptions.py - there are a linger bit of code (most
  for defining nova-specific exceptions that are still retained in
  error_util.py)
- use oslo.vmware vim.py for the Vim implemenation
- use oslo.vmware api.py for api invocation/session
- updated existing unit tests
- nova retains its own version of get_{soap/wsdl}_url which using conf
  settings for default and overrides.

(NOTE: requirements.txt temporary use oslo.vmware without version number
 until the update completes in the requirements project)

commit_message:
vmwareapi oslo.vmware library integration

These are the minimal changes necessary to integrate the vmwareapi
driver with the oslo.vmware code. Much of the change is mechanical
switching to call the library code, and removing obseleted code in the
driver where appropriate.

Effort was made to minimize the amount of actual driver code changes in
this round by keeping a small amount of shim code. Existing unit tests
were modified as appropriate. Additional patches will be introduced
shortly to include additional conversions and tests.

Summary of changes:

- use common/vmware/exceptions.py
- use oslo.vmware vim.py for the Vim implemenation
- use oslo.vmware api.py for api invocation/session
- updated existing unit tests
- nova retains its own version of get_{soap/wsdl}_url which using conf
  settings for default and overrides.

blueprint use-oslo-vmware
Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>
Co-authored-by: Davanum Srinivas <dims@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Idab7778d4c7e5e7099d842debbcbc009cf9127b6

commit_message:
Extract database dumps to function

There was duplication between base and target dumps that is resolved
by use of arguments.

By extracting to function it becomes easier to make changes to how
database dumps are performed. The current setup is a bit hairy,
aggregating in a function makes it easier to improve later.

Change-Id: Ic5d4f13eaa7a4d842c9af0073de17e1cffad0a88

commit_message:
Add try/except for timesync in cold_restart_nodes

Do not fail test if time synchronization fails after
node hard reset and just print warning message.

Closes-bug: #1365446

commit_message:
Integrate VMDK driver with oslo.vmware library

The common code between various VMware drivers was moved to the oslo.vmware
library during Icehouse release. The VMDK driver should be updated to use
this library.

Change-Id: Ia747c402db82ff78969c50dfe8845f04b304675a
Implements: blueprint vmdk-oslo.vmware

commit_message:
Use different serializers for different envs

We should deploy secondary controllers using sequental logic
for 5.0.x clusters.

The commit implements a very basic approach for versioning serializers,
so it may be revised in the future.

Change-Id: Ia94bd16c3060dff76c2c79dca480784092331deb
Closes-Bug: #1364519

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-19 13:47:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Port volumes extension to work in v2.1/v3 framework

Ports v2 volumes extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception
that there is no support for XML. Also

- unittest code modified to share testing with both v2/v2.1
  where appropriate
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods

Note that there will be further code cleanup in the future
but the code currently is mostly as-is from the v2 codebase.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: If2a9dd1f5233812a1177b54ded6f0ae115c54e97

commit_message:
Port volumes extension to work in v2.1/v3 framework

Ports v2 volumes extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception
that there is no support for XML. Also

- unittest code modified to share testing with both v2/v2.1
  where appropriate
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods

Note that there will be further code cleanup in the future
but the code currently is mostly as-is from the v2 codebase.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: If2a9dd1f5233812a1177b54ded6f0ae115c54e97

commit_message:
Allow forms to disable autofill in all browsers

New variable added to form to specify whether it should autofill or
not. This updates the modal forms autocomplete attribute. Hidden
fields are required because Chromium v34+ based browsers ignore the
autocomplete=off form attribute, so the hidden fields catch autofill
data. Any form without self.no_autocomplete = True will just act
like before.

Change-Id: Ibb1722023eea8f57312e1133939d1f75cd909467
Closes-Bug: 1352459

commit_message:
API v1 for creating domains ignore some attributes now

Now API v1 for creating domain returns status 400 when in request POST
body are send attributes like 'created_at', 'updated_at', 'id', or 'serial'

Change-Id: I0b4deda212d3e5137d1224f3fd738e2bc68539bd
Closes-Bug: 1291595

commit_message:
Use 1 connection when running ALTER migrations

if you use migrate_engine.execute() you may get 1 different connection pr call
to execute(), to avoid this we use migrate_engine.begin() to get a connection.

Change-Id: I4600c11be678cbae4810618b5c3a1e38daa45161

subject: Fixes Hyper-V 2008 R2 instance creation failure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3185, 'name': 'Alessandro Pilotti', 'email': 'apilotti@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'alexpilotti'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-14 13:55:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixes Hyper-V 2008 agent failures

Creating an instance on a Hyper-V / Windows Server 2008 R2
compute node fails due to a WMI exception. This happens
while creating creating and configuring the resources to be
added to the VM.

The resources already have set default values for
certain properties, while other properties have NULL.
Trying to set a new value over the NULL causes the exception.

This issue can be avoided by avoiding the WMI object's __setattr__
and instead set the attributes via WMI object's wmi_property
method.

Co-Authored-By: Cristian Valean <cvalean@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Fixes-Bug: #1356884

Change-Id: I54d61989ab97c63207bf6a5b985a3e596f89c20f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-14 13:58:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixes Hyper-V 2008 R2 instance creation failure

Creating an instance on a Hyper-V / Windows Server 2008 R2
compute node fails due to a WMI exception. This happens
while creating creating and configuring the resources to be
added to the VM.

The resources already have set default values for
certain properties, while other properties have NULL.
Trying to set a new value over the NULL causes the exception.

This issue can be avoided by bypassing the WMI object's 
__setattr__ and instead set the attributes via WMI object's
wmi_property method.

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V 2008 R2 instance creation failure

Creating an instance on a Hyper-V / Windows Server 2008 R2
compute node fails due to a WMI exception. This happens
while creating creating and configuring the resources to be
added to the VM.

The resources already have set default values for
certain properties, while other properties have NULL.
Trying to set a new value over the NULL causes the exception.

This issue can be avoided by bypassing the WMI object's
__setattr__ and instead set the attributes via WMI object's
wmi_property method.

Co-Authored-By: Cristian Valean <cvalean@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Fixes-Bug: #1356884

Change-Id: I54d61989ab97c63207bf6a5b985a3e596f89c20f

commit_message:
Don't expect a remote "origin" if you're setting local REPOREFs

If one uses set-sources-vars -l $DIRNAME where $DIRNAME is a git
repository without a remote called "origin", it produces gibberish
output.

This fixes the get_name function so that it behaves correctly in
that instance.

Change-Id: I109315a776b3ab95ba75fe05399d487f6e0b3df8
Closes-bug: 1365022

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-14 18:06:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "libvirt: add version cap to allow limit on use of new features

Add a new 'version_cap' setting in the 'libvirt' group of the
nova.conf file. This allows the cloud admin to artifically
restrict what libvirt features are used by nova. This can be
useful in a number of scenarios

 - Admin wishes to pull in newer libvirt version to address
   a bug, but does not want any change in behaviour of nova
   by having it use different libvirt features

 - Admin is running a cloud with a variety of base OS versions
   and wants Nova to use the same libvirt feature set across
   all nodes despite some nodes having newer libvirt.

 - Admin wants to ensure their cloud deployment is only using
   libvirt features that were tested by the OpenStack CI
   system.

The default value of the config parameter is None, so no
attempt is made to cap the version out of the box.

Change-Id: I1e056d1136b83fc0626529b2fbb617e048132c36

DocImpact: libvirt.version_cap config parameter added
Change-Id: I1e056d1136b83fc0626529b2fbb617e048132c36
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
libvirt: add version cap to allow limit on use of new features

Add a new 'version_cap' setting in the 'libvirt' group of the
nova.conf file. This allows the cloud admin to artifically
restrict what libvirt features are used by nova. This can be
useful in a number of scenarios

 - Admin wishes to pull in newer libvirt version to address
   a bug, but does not want any change in behaviour of nova
   by having it use different libvirt features

 - Admin is running a cloud with a variety of base OS versions
   and wants Nova to use the same libvirt feature set across
   all nodes despite some nodes having newer libvirt.

 - Admin wants to ensure their cloud deployment is only using
   libvirt features that were tested by the OpenStack CI
   system.

The default value of the config parameter is None, so no
attempt is made to cap the version out of the box.

DocImpact: libvirt.version_cap config parameter added
Change-Id: I1e056d1136b83fc0626529b2fbb617e048132c36

commit_message:
Ensure subnet_create does not use explicit arguments when setting enable-dhcp

* [--disable-dhcp] [--enable-dhcp] was added in python-neutron-client 2.3.5
* --enable-dhcp=BOOL was ignored with python-neutron-client <= 2.3.4 -
  puppet-neutron had it since quantumclient times...

Change-Id: I8e9d79126be46d202a94053127e09cd1088997da

commit_message:
Requirements for fuel_health changed

Higher boundary of the version interval for paramiko removed to meet
consistency with version defined in packages spec for fuel-ostf in
fuel-main.

Change-Id: Icadf93f6c2ad1892651b2719b2fb1a123852b74a
Closes-Bug: #1361730

commit_message:
Lower log level for notification registration

Registering an internal notification isn't something that an admin
would generally be interested in, and if they are they can configure
debug logging for keystone.notifications.

Closes-Bug: #1363704

Change-Id: Id7cd3bf2e1f373b818329978553eb53af399386c

commit_message:
Add log translation hints for Nova

Current oslo libraries support translating log messages using different
translation domains and oslo would like to see hints in all of our code
by the end of juno. So cinder should handle the changes out over the
release.

blueprint log-translation-hints
Change-Id: Ib5280f560fec4e53ee591d3e17b48b64c4d96314

After this fix, the Heat keystoneclient plugin should pick up
the right region to authenticate.

subject: Fix for adding panel to panel group via plugin
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 07:35:04.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix for adding panel to panel group via plugin

When adding panels to panel group, it should also be added to the
list of panels at the class atttribute. Otherwise, it will lose the
reference to the panels when _autodiscover() is triggered.

Change-Id: Ifa530d5a39f48d9fd9cd0ea66f6c16594447058b
Closes-Bug: #1329050
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix for adding panel to panel group via plugin

When adding panels to panel group, it should also be added to the
list of panels at the class atttribute. Otherwise, it will lose the
reference to the panels when _autodiscover() is triggered.

Change-Id: Ifa530d5a39f48d9fd9cd0ea66f6c16594447058b
Closes-Bug: #1329050

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Change-Id: Iabf6e55146412b57b6a6544f312f9510f762566a
Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Fix wrong redirect url after instance resizing

When the instances is paginated in multiple pages, the redirect
url for instance resizing best to be the current page.

Change-Id: Ifa7f9c5cd57430640af35b49f93c1cb1c6c5521d
Closes-bug: 1354969

subject: Allow us to use keystoneclient's session
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-28 01:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/client.py', 'cinderclient/exceptions.py', 'cinderclient/v1/client.py', 'cinderclient/v2/client.py'], 'message': "Allow us to use keystoneclient's session

The session object is a cross-client means of standardizing the
transport layer.

HTTPClient object has diverged significantly from other clients. It is
easier to simply replace it if a session is provided. If a session is
provided then users of the library need to be aware that functions such
as authenticate() will no longer have any effect/are in error because
this is no longer managed by cinderclient.

Change-Id: I8935598bda8adb014d1055e39721d8eb35b3ef50
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow us to use keystoneclient's session

The session object is a cross-client means of standardizing the
transport layer.

HTTPClient object has diverged significantly from other clients. It is
easier to simply replace it if a session is provided. If a session is
provided then users of the library need to be aware that functions such
as authenticate() will no longer have any effect/are in error because
this is no longer managed by cinderclient.

Change-Id: I8935598bda8adb014d1055e39721d8eb35b3ef50

commit_message:
Convert console_output v3 plugin to v2.1

Changes required to have v3 plugin natively support
the v2 API

The get_console_output action is reverted to os-getConsoleOutput

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api
Change-Id: I71b0d5fd1a098052f8e11f60a19113b6d647ef2d

commit_message:
JSON Home relationships for auth resources

The new auth resources were missing the JSON Home relationship.

bp json-home

Change-Id: Ia47f18f84f134226a351c24c2f3b0a28a835c58c

[{'created': '2014-02-24 17:51:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Need ability to evacuate host in syspanel

Implement host evacuate in the hypervisors panel.
An extra tab was added to show in the first one hypervisors
and on the second one compute host. on each compute host
that is down an evacuate host button was added.
If the user press the button a modal windows is shown to
request the needed data to perform the evacuation

commit_message:
Need ability to evacuate host in syspanel

Implement host evacuate in the hypervisors panel.
An extra tab was added to show in the first one hypervisors
and on the second one compute host. on each compute host
that is down an evacuate host button was added.
If the user press the button a modal windows is shown to
request the needed data to perform the evacuation.

blueprint evacuate-host

Co-Authored-By: Leandro Costantino <leandro.i.costantino@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Lyle <david.lyle@hp.com>

Change-Id: I57a16f99fddd84c287429085c7e90beb59a17aa3

Cleanup superfluous string comprehension and coersion

Remove the superfluous string comprehension and coersion to string
type in a join within the keystone.notifications module. The elements
in the namedtuple are already string types.

commit_message:
Ensure token is a string

Token is passed as a header from wsgi to HTTPD
If that token is unicode, it triggers an exception in mod_wsgi

Closes-Bug: 1312971

Change-Id: I4bb6ef6c98fbcd35435956d701f1ee3281e9935a
(cherry picked from commit ba1bba8257716c2f5aa668e496173e96a80f0e43)

commit_message:
Prevent SystemExits when running tests

Adds a check for SystemExit exceptions during tests
to convert them into a test failure rather than an exit.
Includes the traceback in the failure so the source of
the exit can be located.

Related-Bug: #1364171
Change-Id: I2c7d9010ebf935d39ed58fe7a6fc4a1a867e2548

commit_message:
Preparation for enabling H302 rule

Currently H302 rule is ignored by tox. However, this rule should
be enabled. This patch partially fixes this problem to prepare for
H302 rule.

Change-Id: I8ede94ed865c699fc287af3af01aae0e631db720

commit_message:
Test cleanup: do not leak FDs during test runs

Avoid leaking file descriptors during test runs. Instead use a secure
tempfile fixture that guarantees the file descriptor from
tempfile.mkstemp is closed and that performs the appropriate cleanup
on the tempfile name in the cleanup phase.

Change-Id: I7e1ddd3122d72d8850794df9467f7b6c0608ac2d

commit_message:
Allow configuration of Cinder API workers

  - Set default to 1
  - Add additional setting explanation
  - Fix typo in setting explenation

Change-Id: Ice9fbe149df6abdedcbdea8cea4e56e4a397a48d

commit_message:
ofagent: Local arp responder for VLAN

Implement local arp responder for non-tunnel network types.
Enable it for VLAN by requesting l2pop for VLAN.

Related: blueprint ofagent-l2pop
Related: blueprint ofagent-merge-bridges
Change-Id: I2f200a1ae2bd769ea1f83fe65e58e82325ed92b0

commit_message:
Default to keystone V3 for software deployment

This patch makes keystone V3 as the default auth_url for software
deployment metadata, as expected by heat collector of
os-collect-config.

Change-Id: Ie90978f79e4e8521caad8a12272105e842ef63a5
Closes-Bug: #1337689

commit_message:
Modify the way to get 'network_id' of the port

This patch change to get 'network_id' from port info, instead of
from subnet info.

Implements blueprint implement-ec2eip-updatable

Change-Id: I51ed7e71af4c7223df9e399e189389fd655a9746

commit_message:
Add initial files for certificate event handling

The SSL certificate generation and workflow blueprint called for adding
support for a certificate events plugin. This CR defines an interface for this
plugin, a simple default logging-based implementation, and an example
integration with the task resource logic.

Change-Id: Ia46793a1ce767ff03d77da06bf5a2803e7dce121
Implements: blueprint add-ssl-ca-support

subject: Changed order of arguments
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-28 18:38:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Changed order of arguments

The order of arguments for the following trove commands
was changed:

trove backup-create

trove configuration-attach

This change is documented in the following bug:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1325121

What changed is that now (for both cmds), you pass in the
instance ID as the first arg.

The following doc page contains examples that show the
old syntax:

http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/trove-manage-db.html

I updated the doc so it shows the new syntax.

commit_message:
Changed order of arguments

The order of arguments for the following trove commands
was changed:

trove backup-create

trove configuration-attach

This change is documented in the following bug:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1325121

What changed is that now (for both cmds), you pass in the
instance ID as the first arg.

The following doc page contains examples that show the
old syntax:

http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/trove-manage-db.html

I updated the doc so it shows the new syntax.

Change-Id: Ic7fd24947332500ce102c3902a7ec84be4f3d542
Partial-Bug: #1325121

Update tables, create some new tables and add them to the config
reference.

commit_message:
Use mkstemp() instead of deprecated mktemp()

The tempfile.mktemp() function has been deprecated since Python 2.3
due to security issues.

https://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.mktemp

Fixes bug 1348869

Change-Id: Ief35c662580364499991fb520b69d2039e8b7ad0

commit_message:
Add note about neutron-db-manage

I added a note to cover occasional instances where users
may need to run neutron-db-manage to populate the neutron
database. I want to leave this note out of the Juno version
for now.

Change-Id: Ia80f8f8f3768467c59dab98e0e5569aeb211206e
Closes-Bug: #1343277

commit_message:
Fix wrong disk type limitation for disk IO throttling

The disk I/O limits feature in QEMU block layer allows I/O throttling
to be used across all underlying storage types.

Change-Id: If99107955fc976b00ee101d4c6a685c29e655f82
Closes-Bug: #1362129

commit_message:
Add PostgreSQL support

Commit adds instance creation, CRUD operations, and backup/restore
operations for postgresql to Trove.

Implements: blueprint postgresql-support

Change-Id: I1b5ace42d75f492d70b30824e58f3d406827bdfc

commit_message:
Adds SNMP power driver

Add a new PowerDriver module for remote control of node power by
enabling or disabling sockets on a rack power strip via SNMP.

Implements: blueprint ironic-snmp-power-driver
Change-Id: Ib16781eaa9737525c4d8a9231ecd9e72d7e2645e
Co-authored-by: David Hewson <dhewson@cray.com>
Co-authored-by: Mark Goddard <mgoddard@cray.com>

Datacenter moid should not be tuple

Remove the comma, because it will convert the string to tuple
Closes-bug: #1362480

Change-Id: I2debb76bae26fe3d437a431f2946f66a1cbe6851
(cherry picked from commit ace3a01ebf980c166b4dfe6d1216b17bf0aec2ed)

commit_message:
Previously, the Modulefile did not include Keystone.

This would cause the module to not install all necessary
dependencies for Heat services.  This patch allows Heat to have
consistent dependencies with other OpenStack services.

Change-Id: Ie9dffb84b19db152c5bfd251cd96d41baabdd31f

commit_message:
Adds ability to override service name for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the service in the service catalog to
match auth_name, this allows the ability to explicitly set the service
name, separately from auth_name.

Change-Id: I142b9e944eacdeba8a029d7f15f067ef5f1f87a4

commit_message:
Enable and start httpd

The Horizon element should enable and start httpd during
os-refresh-config so that the dashboad is useable without any manual
intervention.

assignment in a more canonical and verbose form, we are sure that we are
actually covering the possible branches while testing.

commit_message:
Remove some inline if/else statements

Even though python syntax allows it, assignment of variables using
inline if...else... statements have the nasty problem of not showing
relevant information in the test coverage. Thus, by writing the
assignment in a more canonical and verbose form, we are sure that we are
actually covering the possible branches while testing.

Change-Id: I4fbce4422f4986a76255ad468ee7dd7475e3f1cf

subject: Add id_attribute and resource_name to resource
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-25 21:54:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Add id_attribute and resource_name to resource

The resource had 'id' hard coded all over the place and this
caused problems if the key for the resource was not 'id'.
The id_attribute can be used to override that now.  The
resource_name can be used for printed errors and strings
associated with the resource rather than teh resource_key.

Change-Id: I66afa842b8315e24d1a2e0698983440bf97ae986
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add id_attribute and resource_name to resource

The resource had 'id' hard coded all over the place and this
caused problems if the key for the resource was not 'id'.
The id_attribute can be used to override that now.  The
resource_name can be used for printed errors and strings
associated with the resource rather than teh resource_key.

Change-Id: I66afa842b8315e24d1a2e0698983440bf97ae986

subject: Remove disable_interface from dhcp-all-interfaces
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-14 20:33:30.000000000', 'files': ['elements/dhcp-all-interfaces/install.d/dhcp-all-interfaces.sh'], 'message': "Remove disable_interface from dhcp-all-interfaces

I don't actually think there is a way that disable_interface
would get called on Fedora... because if config_exists
it takes a different path. Furthermore we really don't
want to mess w/ configured interfaces in dhcp-all-interfaces
because that could be side effecty (and is arguably the
job os os-net-config anyways).

This function already did nothing on Debian so removing
shouldn't hurt anything.

Change-Id: Ic53bbab98aa03d487efd290ae8e076045781b5b1
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove disable_interface from dhcp-all-interfaces

I don't actually think there is a way that disable_interface
would get called on Fedora... because if config_exists
it takes a different path. Furthermore we really don't
want to mess w/ configured interfaces in dhcp-all-interfaces
because that could be side effecty (and is arguably the
job os os-net-config anyways).

This function already did nothing on Debian so removing
shouldn't hurt anything.

Change-Id: Ic53bbab98aa03d487efd290ae8e076045781b5b1

commit_message:
Reorganize code to use store crypto plug-in

We have made changes in code organization, this
CR is to sync crypto code with new organization and
store plug-in. Specifically for asymmetric generation
contracts

- Regenerated alembic version file
- Changed the branch name

Change-Id: I6d1686a4507bfbce5204ca41ed938c723ad0668d

commit_message:
Support the same api versions format as keystone

This will allow us to take advantage of the discovery functionality that's gone
into keystone meaning less of our own discovery code in the client.

Change-Id: I51550d0c4994ad3b2f9320dea9b8fc9090ade78f

commit_message:
Creating a Recordset doesn't increment the serial number

 If a new recordset is created that contains records, most of
 the time the serial number should be incremented. This fixes
 that problem.

 Closes-Bug:#1361342

Change-Id: Ie5207be43bd30c49914ef1edb960c4bfc58e6892

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-02 17:59:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_schedulers.py'], 'message': 'Fix DVR to unbind SNAT namespaces on gateway clear

Earlier fix to enable LBaaS in DVR with review #114141
updated the get_compute_ports_on_xxx ml2 plugin method
with get_ports_on_xxx.

The DVR scheduler needs to be upgraded to use this
new method to unbind SNAT namespaces.

Change-Id: I08a2b30a1ad0da222276f5d2a1cd1c3f840787a2
Closes-Bug: #1362908
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix DVR to unbind SNAT namespaces on gateway clear

Earlier fix to enable LBaaS in DVR with review #114141
updated the get_compute_ports_on_xxx ml2 plugin method
with get_ports_on_xxx.

The DVR scheduler needs to be upgraded to use this
new method to unbind SNAT namespaces.

Change-Id: I08a2b30a1ad0da222276f5d2a1cd1c3f840787a2
Closes-Bug: #1362908

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-14 21:00:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add UEFI based deployment support in Ironic

Most of the new hardware comes with UEFI boot mode, which has several
technical advantages over the traditional BIOS system.

Operator inform the boot mode to ironic using the "capabilities" property
of the node.  The operator may add a new capability "boot_mode=uefi" or
"boot_mode=bios" in "capabilities" within "properties" of the node.

Add new pxe config options:
  - "uefi_pxe_bootfile_name": specify the efi bootloader to be used.
  - "uefi_pxe_config_template": specify the respective efi bootloader config
    template.

As of now only elilo.efi bootloader is supported.

elilo.efi bootloader requires the configuration file to be named after the
ip-address assigned by the DHCP server.

Change-Id: I0ad399b2207d7c66f6887e56470ba553b3c87b53

Operator inform the boot mode to ironic using the "capabilities" property
of the node.  The operator may add a new capability "boot_mode=uefi" or
"boot_mode=bios" in "capabilities" within "properties" of the node.

Add new pxe config options:
  - "uefi_pxe_bootfile_name": specify the efi bootloader to be used.
  - "uefi_pxe_config_template": specify the respective efi bootloader config
    template.

As of now only elilo.efi bootloader is supported.

elilo.efi bootloader requires the configuration file to be named after the
ip-address assigned by the DHCP server.

Implements: blueprint uefi-boot-for-ironic

commit_message:
Add UEFI based deployment support in Ironic

Most of the new hardware comes with UEFI boot mode, which has several
technical advantages over the traditional BIOS system.

Operator inform the boot mode to ironic using the "capabilities" property
of the node.  The operator may add a new capability "boot_mode=uefi" or
"boot_mode=bios" in "capabilities" within "properties" of the node.

Add new pxe config options:
  - "uefi_pxe_bootfile_name": specify the efi bootloader to be used.
  - "uefi_pxe_config_template": specify the respective efi bootloader config
    template.

As of now only elilo.efi bootloader is supported.

elilo.efi bootloader requires the configuration file to be named after the
ip-address assigned by the DHCP server.

Implements: blueprint uefi-boot-for-ironic
Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
Change-Id: I0ad399b2207d7c66f6887e56470ba553b3c87b53

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-24 01:59:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'TripleO and backwards compatibility

TripleO has run with good but not perfect backwards compatibility
since creation. Its time to formalise this in a documentable and
testable fashion.

We will strive to only break backwards compatibility when all known
uses of the code are for no longer supported OpenStack releases. We
may break backwards compatibility with PTL signoff at other times.

Semver will make it clear to consumers of TripleO - whether
distributors or end users - when this has happened.

Change-Id: I7b63e7860d0ea58faf46c5f5483ae9fc475dbbe9

commit_message:
TripleO and backwards compatibility

TripleO has run with good but not perfect backwards compatibility
since creation. It's time to formalise this in a documentable and
testable fashion.

We will stop deliberately breaking backwards compatibility that is
needed by any supported OpenStack release, unless there is a PTL
signoff (which will be reserved for exceptional circumstances).

Semantic versioning will make it clear to consumers of TripleO -
whether distributors or end users - when this has happened.

Change-Id: I7b63e7860d0ea58faf46c5f5483ae9fc475dbbe9

commit_message:
Improve install guide cinder controller section

I improved the cinder controller section of the installation
guide as follows:

1) Reordered instructions.
2) Added python-cinderclient package to all distributions.
3) Added glossary terms.

Change-Id: Idecafff0a1cd2f98ca7d2666bd1e402df341de7a
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Glance: Avoid unecessary call if image_id is None

This commit adds a check to avoid an unecessary api call
if image_id is None when using methods: 'show', 'delete',
'update', 'download'.
Also it updates delete from the API to handle the new introduced
exception 'InvalidImageRef'

Change-Id: I8e7920d90ea02e3b17d9773324fbe1b082fd0353
Closes-Bug: #1311137
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@cloudwatt.com>

commit_message:
Add vmedia boot support in IPA

This commit adds support for booting IPA from virtual
media cdrom.  When IPA is booted over virtual media cdrom,
the parameters to the IPA are passed in a text file within
the virtual media floppy.

Change-Id: Ia04585416aada85022af73fb2b945bd3895606f0

commit_message:
Move cinder volumes to compute node

Moving cinder volumes to compute node for better performance. This
will also reduce the load on the networks as the volume drive to be
attached will work on the same node as the VM instances are launched.

Change-Id: Ibc4c5b371882e71c30a1c5ee4517e6b5f93daf13

[{'created': '2014-09-01 18:04:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Only bind SAIO daemons to localhost

The SAIO configs have no default bind_ip setting configured which causes them to listen on all available IP addresses. commit_message:
Only bind SAIO daemons to localhost

The SAIO configs have no default bind_ip setting configured
which causes them to listen on all available IP addresses.
This can be dangerous on a test machine with public interfaces,
especially with the default passwords set. Its reasonable to
choose a more restrictive setup, especially in SAIO which uses
127.0.0.1 throughout ring-builder, example commands and the
probe tests.

Change-Id: I471c49705ce09e07ec7acc07ee42a1e220529b82

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-03 15:36:52.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute/rbd.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_rbd_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Fix file location for nova compute rbd secret

The rbd secret location was mixed between /etc/nova
and /etc/ceph. This patch changes the secret to
be in /etc/nova for both the file and exec
resources so that virsh secrets are set correctly

Change-Id: I50f0324d911f20d5a072c769edcf289ae59f817a
(cherry picked from commit aad7a0a7cbb2770d4d1f668c1b8fe871cd7d7205)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix file location for nova compute rbd secret

The rbd secret location was mixed between /etc/nova
and /etc/ceph. This patch changes the secret to
be in /etc/nova for both the file and exec
resources so that virsh secrets are set correctly

Change-Id: I50f0324d911f20d5a072c769edcf289ae59f817a
(cherry picked from commit aad7a0a7cbb2770d4d1f668c1b8fe871cd7d7205)

When using user namespaces, the contents of the container's
file systems need to be owned by the targeted user on the host.
These functions will change the ownership of the files in the
filesystem to the proper owners.

For example, when mapping root in the container to user 500
on the host, the contents of the filesystem owned by root need
to be changed to be owned by user 500.

commit_message:
Add functions to setup user namespaced filesystems

When using user namespaces, the contents of the container's
file systems need to be owned by the targeted user on the host.
These functions will change the ownership of the files in the
filesystem to the proper owners.

For example, when mapping root in the container to user 500
on the host, the contents of the filesystem owned by root need
to be changed to be owned by user 500.

Partially implements: bp libvirt-lxc-user-namespaces

Change-Id: I78afc2686f17b5e5ec740a3d0a1963df7cc92755

commit_message:
Adds a manual garbage collector script

It's the responsibility of the operator to call the garbage
collector manually. Using crontab or a similar tool is advised.

A more intelligent approach for this will be added in a follow-up
patch.

Change-Id: I9cf22a5c65920be0eaff909c8f090d29ef300d1f

GET /v2/{tenant_id}/os-networks

The doc
http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/GET_os-networks-v2_ListNetworks__v2__tenant_id__os-networks_ext-os-networks.html
says this "Lists networks that are available to the tenant".

When invoked by a non-admin user it was returning only networks
assigned to the user's tenant.  But in flat and flat DHCP nova
networking, networks CAN NOT be assigned to tenants --- thus a
non-admin user would get zero networks from this operation.

The fix was to make this operation conditionally use an option already
present in the lower-level code to "allow_none" when fetching the list
of networks, meaning to include networks whose project_id field in the
DB held "none" (meaning the network is not assigned to a tenant).  The
condition under which this is done is that the Nova configuration
option named network_manager contains the string
"'nova.network.manager.Flat" --- which is true for flat and flat DHCP
nova networking and false for VLAN nova networking.

Change-Id: I64c5a3f31c912cca6b5b9987152ba7a9b3f5987d
Closes-Bug: #1327406

commit_message:
Made unassigned networks visible in flat networking

This change fixes a bug in Nova's
GET /v2/{tenant_id}/os-networks

The doc
http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/GET_os-networks-v2_ListNetworks__v2__tenant_id__os-networks_ext-os-networks.html
says that "Lists networks that are available to the tenant".

When invoked by a non-admin user it was returning only networks
assigned to the user's tenant.  But in flat and flat DHCP nova
networking, networks CAN NOT be assigned to tenants --- thus a
non-admin user would get zero networks from this operation.

The fix was to make this operation conditionally use an option already
present in the lower-level code to "allow_none" when fetching the list
of networks, meaning to include networks whose project_id field in the
DB held "none" (meaning the network is not assigned to a tenant).  The
condition under which this is done is that the Nova configuration
option named network_manager contains the string
"'nova.network.manager.Flat" --- which is true for flat and flat DHCP
nova networking and false for VLAN nova networking.

Change-Id: I64c5a3f31c912cca6b5b9987152ba7a9b3f5987d
Closes-Bug: #1327406

subject: Improve install guide security content
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-02 23:02:27.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_basics-security.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_basics.xml'], 'message': "Improve install guide security content

I improved security content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Renamed basic environment 'passwords' section to 'security' to
   generalize topic.
2) Generalized existing content.
3) Added content about administrative privilege requirements
   including potential interference with deployment automation
   tools.

Recommend backporting to Icehouse.

Change-Id: Ide9785728c7b52ee1dc59a533b3486b99ee11139
Closes-Bug: #1311426
backport: icehouse
(cherry picked from commit 80ca377eb8c4d2a448f707cdb663d5e0f0db857e)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improve install guide security content

I improved security content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Renamed basic environment 'passwords' section to 'security' to
   generalize topic.
2) Generalized existing content.
3) Added content about administrative privilege requirements
   including potential interference with deployment automation
   tools.

Recommend backporting to Icehouse.

Change-Id: Ide9785728c7b52ee1dc59a533b3486b99ee11139
Closes-Bug: #1311426
backport: icehouse
(cherry picked from commit 80ca377eb8c4d2a448f707cdb663d5e0f0db857e)

This patch add some v3 aggregate API unittest into V2 API to improve
V2 API unittesting.

commit_message:
Encrypt heat template parameters

Encrypt hidden parameters before storing them in database
and decrypt on stack load.

Specification document https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100343/

Change-Id: I8fe686ab1dfd86baa4b29d9ad4604873e48fa03e
Implements: blueprint encrypt-hidden-parameters

commit_message:
Anticipate Plan delete DBReferenceError

Catch the DBReferenceError when trying to delete a Plan
with living Assemblies, and hand back a friendlier error message
and a 409.

Change-Id: I716441b7fde6e69cbf69a9d29fa5180c7290cd68

commit_message:
Ensure volumes are detached and that instances are deleted

This patch is based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86638/ but
we still use the nova calls instead.  We fall back on metadata
to cinder api calls to cleanup metadata and continue when we have
a failure.  This should do the trick for the time being.

Close-Bug #1298350

commit_message:
Octavia v0.5 component design

This design represents the overall layout of components that will
make up the first major milestone release of Octavia (v0.5). The
intent here is to have a scalable service delivery layer, to get
communication with external components right, and not yet worry
about making the command and control layer scalable.

Change-Id: I09ab7185683b66ec2567119616bc54cf9d8cc000

commit_message:
Use metadata.create_all() to initialise DB schema

There is no need to run database migration each time, when we want to
get a new actual database schema. Running all migration scripts takes a
long time on production databases and can be not suitable for SQLite
because of Alembic limitation.

Added create_schema() method, which supposes to be used for initial
installation instead of upgrade('head').

Partial-Bug: #1347604

Change-Id: I039d955f051eda015bef2299122fd1f0fb5c46da

commit_message:
Ignore ceph packages in patching

Blacklist for ceph packages should be considered as a workaround.
We should create a solution for pre-moderated whitelist of approved
packages for patching.

Change-Id: I05ff7eb67efc9e6bbf3813c4ef8ce0774d766112
Closes-Bug: #1363983

commit_message:
Ignore ceph packages in patching

Blacklist for ceph packages should be considered as a workaround.
We should create a solution for pre-moderated whitelist of approved
packages for patching.

Change-Id: I05ff7eb67efc9e6bbf3813c4ef8ce0774d766112
Closes-Bug: #1363983

commit_message:
Sort requirement files in alphabetical order

This makes code more readable, and can check easily for specific library
in the requirement files. We also enforce the check in pep8.

Change-Id: I71d125671ce51fcbddeef66bdc4516800b6e4cbc
Closes-Bug: #1285478

commit_message:
Implementation of Endpoint Grouping

The Endpoint Filter extension has been extended to support Endpoint
Grouping which provides a dynamic endpoint attribute filtering capability
that is directly associated with a project.

Change-Id: I7b628ac565f58077ff7521458cc1d02b3bf47d29
implements bp multi-attribute-endpoint-grouping

commit_message:
Control extra space for images conversion in image_cache

Size of image converted to raw format can be growing up to virtual_size.
This patch adds new _fetch_to_raw function to image_cache which try to
free extra space for image conversion if needed.

Closes-Bug: #1356362
Change-Id: I69712b078113ef0640859389ef4ab9039135f612

commit_message:
Cleanup WBE example to be simpler to understand

This makes the example simpler to follow and understand when
it is using threads, is in one file and just uses the simpler
in-memory kombu backend by default (it can still use the file
transport if configured to use it).

Change-Id: I7fe9758e3285e7f0a610482bf26322841fb22f39

Remove status initialization from plugin's create_firewall

This is overwritten by the DB class method, so here is
not necessary.

commit_message:
Removes test_force_delete_server_invalid_state negative test

Commit I06a476701ccb47d8f7fd6e43c394ccb3fac2b3aa allows the force
deleting of running instances as well as those in soft-delete state
so this negative test is no longer appropriate.

Related-Bug: #1351001
Change-Id: Ia6d09fea753196a8bc9f33ac8acaae49f1d306e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-30 11:11:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'tests: fix test_compute to have predictable service list

The _create_service_entries() method in test_compute.py accepted
a dict for the list of services. The tests would then pull out
the first item in the list of keys of the dict. When the python
hash seed is set to a random value the list of keys has no
predictable ordering, causing the test suite to break. Changing
the data structure to use a list of lists instead of a dict
ensures strict ordering.

Related-bug: #1350287
Change-Id: I01a0d4cfb086eb94b49d25b65daf08e55e2087b4

commit_message:
tests: fix test_compute to have predictable service list

The _create_service_entries() method in test_compute.py accepted
a dict for the list of services. The tests would then pull out
the first item in the list of keys of the dict. When the python
hash seed is set to a random value the list of keys has no
predictable ordering, causing the test suite to break. Changing
the data structure to use a list of lists instead of a dict
ensures strict ordering.

Related-bug: #1350287
Change-Id: I01a0d4cfb086eb94b49d25b65daf08e55e2087b4

commit_message:
Add use of guestagent install shell script in infra dibs

all dibs elements have to be placed in the same directory
otherwise we cannot execute diskimage-builder command with
multiple elements. In our case we have to use guestagent
element with each infra element (drone, jenkins, gitolite).

Change-Id: I6e55350630e982adec1b338309421c7bdca4c9c3

commit_message:
Introduce Hitachi storage volume driver

This patch introduces Hitachi storage volume driver.

Implements: blueprint hitachi-block-storage-driver

Certification test result for FC:

commit_message:
Made provision for glance service to use Launcher

After sending SIGHUP signal to glance-service parent process,
it will call SIGHUP callback handler and then throws OSError.
The OSError is thrown because os.wait system call was
interrupted due to SIGHUP callback handler. As a result of
this parent process closes the server socket.
All child processes also gets terminated without completing
existing api requests because the server socket is already
closed and the service doesn't restart.

Added service module, launcher and common service module with
its dependencies from oslo-incubator in glance service.

After modifying the implemenatation, glance-service is able to
restart on sending SIGHUP signal to parent process and also
completing existing api requests.

Made provision to pass default hub to eventlet.hubs.use_hub()
in oslo-incubator common service famework. Defined new configuration
parameter 'eventlet_hub' with default value as 'poll' in glance.cmd.api
and glance.cmd.registry  and leveraged same to service framework of
oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I04d65225c3d01985fe35f36bf87b662bf190e23a

commit_message:
Implement validation on Trust V3 API

Use JSONschema on create operations on V3 Trust API.

This change refactors a lot of the test_v3_auth tests to get them to
pass with proper validation.

Closes-Bug: #1362344
bp: api-validation

Change-Id: If4b59a6ac84e308eff8bf5ea35772173b0ba7fe5

commit_message:
Remove concatenation with translated messages

Translated messages should not be expanded by concatenation.  Instead
the additional text should be replacement text or part of the translated
message to allow the translators as much information as possible when
doing the translations.

Also, when lazy translation is enabled, the object returned does not
support concatenation and raises an exception.  Thus this patch is
needed to support blueprint: i18n-enablement.

This patch includes a hacking check for concatenation with a translated
message.

Change-Id: I8b368d275faa14b4750735445321874ce1da37d5
Partially-Implements: blueprint i18n-enablement

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-26 11:35:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add support for glusterfs native protocol driver

This patch adds basic support for glusterfs native protocol driver
that uses cert based access type.

A Manila share is a GlusterFS volume. Unlike the generic driver, this
does not use service VM approach. Instances directly talk with the
GlusterFS backend storage pool. Instance use the 'glusterfs' protocol
to mount the GlusterFS share. Access to the share is allowed via
SSL Certificates. Only the share which has the SSL trust established
with the GlusterFS backend can mount and hence use the share.

Establishing the SSL trust between the instance and backend is done
out of band of Manila.

TODOs:
* Add testcases

Partially-implements blueprint cert-based-access-type

Change-Id: I229d481086478317f1c43635304a16794372f09d

commit_message:
Add support for glusterfs native protocol driver

This patch adds basic support for glusterfs native protocol driver
that uses cert based access type.

A Manila share is a GlusterFS volume. Unlike the generic driver, this
does not use service VM approach. Instances directly talk with the
GlusterFS backend storage pool. Instance use the 'glusterfs' protocol
to mount the GlusterFS share. Access to the share is allowed via
SSL Certificates. Only the share which has the SSL trust established
with the GlusterFS backend can mount and hence use the share.

Establishing the SSL trust between the instance and backend is done
out of band of Manila.

Partially-implements blueprint cert-based-access-type

Change-Id: I229d481086478317f1c43635304a16794372f09d

commit_message:
Context selection for project and region

Providing the mechanism to easily switch between projects and regions.

Only shows domain info if OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT is set
to True in settings.

Will add domain switching for v3 once support for it is complete.
Will add advance filtering rules in follow up patch.

Co-Authored-By: David Lyle <david.lyle@hp.com>

Implements: blueprint context-selection

Change-Id: Ie6e81eebe822ab2394b07345d148a1c06a33a25f

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-23 19:16:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add detach-replication support

Update the taskmanager and instance model to propagate a
detach-replication request to the guest. The detach-replication operation
can only be called on an instance with a replication master -- i.e. an
instance with a non-null slave_of_id.

This patch depends on:
 - guestagent API calls for replication
 - slave_of_id on the instance model

Partially Implements: blueprint replication-v1

Change-Id: I3596a3b76cc484b42db38f02e51c028d5ff2ed6c

commit_message:
Add detach-replica support

Add a PATCH route to unset the slave_of property on an instance, i.e. to
detach a replica from its replication source.

Rename existing 'detach_replication_slave' functions to 'detach_replica'
to be consistent with the python-troveclient.

Add test case to tests/api/replication.py.

Partially Implements: blueprint replication-v1

Change-Id: I3596a3b76cc484b42db38f02e51c028d5ff2ed6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-12 21:08:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Big Switch: Separate L3 functions into L3 service

Separate the L3 functions from the core Big Switch
plugin into an L3 service plugin. This is will allow
the L3 functions to be used in ML2 deployments that
use the Big Switch ML2 driver.

Implements: blueprint bsn-l3-service-plugin
Change-Id: I889db0047fb9a85f02d1fb95b9c099e9243a5bb5
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-14 06:05:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Big Switch: Separate L3 functions into L3 service

plugin into an L3 service plugin. This is will allow
the L3 functions to be used in ML2 deployments that
use the Big Switch ML2 driver.

commit_message:
Big Switch: Separate L3 functions into L3 service

Separate the L3 functions from the core Big Switch
plugin into an L3 service plugin. This is will allow
the L3 functions to be used in ML2 deployments that
use the Big Switch ML2 driver.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint bsn-l3-service-plugin
Change-Id: I889db0047fb9a85f02d1fb95b9c099e9243a5bb5

commit_message:
Disable oslo.messaging debug logs

ioslo.messaging debug logs are too verbose, turn them off. A similar
patch dropped nova-conductor logs in the gate down from 7MB to under 300K.

Cherry-Pick from oslo-incubator since we are in feature freeze:
Ia12c003dae196e2220a5f6ea768758a75f2ede23 and
Icc61964c6a2b002ac1c8566f174e6a5230674c75

Change-Id: I48733823e178afd2f22d81d584bb73f95ec9a7cd

commit_message:
Mark the revoke kvs backend deprecated, for removal in Kilo

Although the kvs.Base was marked as deprecated, the individual
backends were not.  This marks the kvs revoke backend.

Change-Id: I6592cce10687e355536a4c9f89fc885692a73e23
Partially-implements: bp deprecated-as-of-juno

commit_message:
VMware: Do not read opaque type for DVS network

Save backend calls when using DVS VIF type. There is no need to
get the opaque network in the event that we have a DVS network.

Change-Id: I75973005193f862dfde3b99167cb53d3114a8349

commit_message:
Port limits extension to work in v2.1/v3 framework

Ports v2 limits extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception that
there is no support for rate limiting since no one uses that
seriously anyway.

- unittest code modified to share testing with both v2/v2.1
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I072d364f4d2a92a02801862435f11417956d2dc0

commit_message:
Implement EC2 eip/eipassociation resources updatable

It supports the AWS::EC2::EIP and AWS::EC2::EIPAssociation resources
updatable to be compatible with AWSCloudFormation.
1. Support 'InstanceId' property updatable for AWS::EC2::EIP resource
2. Support 'InstanceId', 'EIP', 'AllocationId', 'NetworkInterfaceId'
properties updatable for AWS::EC2::EIPAssociation resource
3. Add validate function to check whether provide one of 'EIP' and
'AllocationId' for AWS::EC2::EIPAssociation resource
4. Modify the way to get 'network_id' of the port for
AWS::EC2::EIPAssociation resource
5. Modify if the association is not created successful, don't try to
delete it.

Implements blueprint implement-ec2eip-updatable

Change-Id: I1e6fa87ba5dd89ea41ec9639f6a940f857be33da

subject: Fix file location for nova compute rbd secret
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-28 11:36:04.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute/rbd.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_rbd_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Fix file location for nova compute rbd secret

The rbd secret location was mixed between /etc/nova
and /etc/ceph. This patch changes the secret to
be in /etc/nova for both the file and exec
resources so that virsh secrets are set correctly

Change-Id: I50f0324d911f20d5a072c769edcf289ae59f817a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix file location for nova compute rbd secret

The rbd secret location was mixed between /etc/nova
and /etc/ceph. This patch changes the secret to
be in /etc/nova for both the file and exec
resources so that virsh secrets are set correctly

Change-Id: I50f0324d911f20d5a072c769edcf289ae59f817a

commit_message:
Reorg AutoScalingGroup code

The current class hierarchy of autoscaling groups in Heat is hindering
further improvements to both AWS version and OS version.  On one hand,
we don't want OS resources to extend AWS resources; on the other hand,
we have a lot proposals to enhance the OS version.  Also, the classes
should be split and relocated into different subdirectories.

Change-Id: Idedc141b9f63e4ed20b54bd297d2f737fe1249d1

subject: Configurable base location of worker scripts
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-02 16:04:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Configurable base location of worker scripts

Depending on how Solum is installed, the contrib directory
may not exist in the directory three levels above handlers/shell.
In such a case, shell Handler's build and test functions  will fail
as it cannot find those scripts.

This change takes advantage of the Handler's proj_dir property,
allowing it to supercede the relative path if it's set.
The name proj_dir reflects the directory that contains the contrib directory,
among others, because that is where the original project codebase lies.

Change-Id: I9add45d93d5be801193e7ac45235cb55c347020b
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-02 16:24:30.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/solum', 'solum/worker/handlers/shell.py', 'solum/worker/config.py', 'etc/solum/solum.conf.sample'], 'message': "Configurable base location of worker scripts

Depending on how Solum is installed, the contrib directory
may not exist in the directory three levels above handlers/shell.
In such a case, shell Handler's build and test functions  will fail
as it cannot find those scripts.

This change takes advantage of the Handler's proj_dir property,
allowing it to supercede the relative path if it's set.
The name proj_dir reflects the directory that contains the contrib directory,
among others, because that is where the original project codebase lies.

Change-Id: I9add45d93d5be801193e7ac45235cb55c347020b
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Configurable base location of worker scripts

Depending on how Solum is installed, the contrib directory
may not exist in the directory three levels above handlers/shell.
In such a case, shell Handler's build and test functions  will fail
as it cannot find those scripts.

This change takes advantage of the Handler's proj_dir property,
allowing it to supercede the relative path if it's set.
The name proj_dir reflects the directory that contains the contrib directory,
among others, because that is where the original project codebase lies.

Change-Id: I9add45d93d5be801193e7ac45235cb55c347020b

commit_message:
Add example of using native waitcondition resources

Adds a simple example of using the native WaitCondition and
WaitConditionHandle resources, which work in a similar way to
the CFN compatible ones, but with more relaxed validation of
data, and some additional helper attributes so you don't need
to remember how to write the curl call in the template unless
you need something unusual in the request.

Change-Id: I2686d07e882781e93949ded9dd260161e4514a3b
blueprint: native-waitcondition

commit_message:
Fix and improve autoscaling.yaml

Fixed a problem: the health monitor's delay was less than its timeout,
which is now disallowed.

Added stack outputs that show and explain the webhooks and a
ceilometer query that selects samples about VMs in the stack.
Also added an output that shows the entry IP address.

Change-Id: I11313f05d885cb0698a904f08725227b03617e0c

commit_message:
Get rid of ordered decorator in func tests

Test should not rely on the order of it's execution
Now are tests are independent from each other so ordered decorator is not needed anymore

Change-Id: I2ca86aa91dbe0e6f3b9256d1b2e0005029071118
Closes-Bug: #1363597

commit_message:
Moving git_url into git_info dictionary

This patch is done in anticipation of adding extra
git information like the branch and private keys to
expand on unittest-app and build-app's functionality.

Keeping all the information in one dictionary instead of
as additional kwargs will reduce the need for changes to
solum-worker's API.

Change-Id: I4b15e03b183f3cdcd6f9442288a307cb5ec2792f

commit_message:
Adds ability to override service name for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the service in the service catalog to
match auth_name, this allows the ability to explicitly set the service
name, spearately from auth_name.
If service_name is not specified, it's value defaults to the value
of auth_name (which maintains the current behavior.)

Closes-bug: #1359755
Change-Id: I66dadaebb526cfae2b6c250b2bef97e1e6d6aafe

commit_message:
Adds ability to override service names for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the services in the service catalog to
match auth_name and auth_name_v3, this allows the ability to explicitly
set the service names, separately from auth_name and auth_name_v3.

If service_name or service_name_v3 is not specified, their values
default to the value of auth_name and auth_name_v3, respectively
(which maintains the current behavior.)

Closes-bug: #1359755
Change-Id: Ie34099d6f9746ce883d711a27b9d93613924c3ee

commit_message:
Add rabbit_ha_queues option

In current, rabbit_ha_queues option is controled by rabbit_hosts
if conditional statement. When users want to set rabbit_ha_queues
to true and they don't use rabbit_hosts option, this logic will
not satisfy their needs.

This patch adds an $rabbit_ha_queues option, set it to undef by default
for forward compatbility.

Change-Id: Iaf6157f6b7acb148bd7da41421b4a3de6c4e2194
Closes-bug: 1361700

[{'created': '2014-07-24 16:38:06.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/pkiz.py', 'keystone/token/providers/pki.py'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary whitespace from PKI & PKIZ tokens

This overrides the default key-value separator (normally ": ") in favor
of a separator that does not contain any whitespace (":"), which results
in equivalent JSON.

Change-Id: Iea4a8df74f5e4c511d37894601c28615fb0eda6b
Closes-Bug: 1348262
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary whitespace from PKI & PKIZ tokens

This overrides the default key-value separator (normally ": ") in favor
of a separator that does not contain any whitespace (":"), which results
in equivalent JSON.

Change-Id: Iea4a8df74f5e4c511d37894601c28615fb0eda6b
Closes-Bug: 1348262

commit_message:
Fixes glanceclient gating

requests 2.4.0 was released 2014-08-29 and breaks
glanceclient testing with error:
"ProtocolError: ('Connection aborted.',
gaierror(-2, 'Name or service not known'))"

This change limits the requests version <2.4.0 to allow client gating.

Closes-Bug: #1364893
Co-Author: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Change-Id: I2f2431230b50646fc942aa79cd25ff7edd973026

commit_message:
Port v2 images extension to work in v2.1(v3) framework

Ports v2 images extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception
that there is no support for XML. Also

- unittest code modified to share testing with both v2/v2.1
  where appropriate
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I7b15a56f41612e3bbf5d59c3ad44fd32386ff315

The DRAC wsman_enumerate() method can now raise DracInvalidFilterDialect
if the filter dialect specified is not valid, this patch simply makes
the try..except blocks around the wsman_enumerate() to also handle the

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Handle DracInvalidFilterDialect exception

The DRAC wsman_enumerate() method can now raise DracInvalidFilterDialect
if the filter dialect specified is not valid, this patch simply makes
the try..except blocks around the wsman_enumerate() to also handle the
DracInvalidFilterDialect exception nicely when raised.

Change-Id: Ide029562ce74e25c90dedca3dc6479f2caa5db58

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-07 09:07:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Resolve Vagrant issue 1673

When using the shell or puppet provisionier with Ubuntu there is
always an error message 'stdin: is not a tty'. According to the
bugreport https://github.com/mitchellh/vagrant/issues/1673
using 'bash -c 'BASH_ENV=/etc/profile exec bash'' as shell solves
this issue.

Change-Id: I4aa8b51545f881e548830f91d5b5c543bd6ef613
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-07 09:10:25.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile'], 'message': "Resolve Vagrant issue 1673

When using the shell or puppet provisionier with Ubuntu there is
always an error message 'stdin: is not a tty'. According to the
bugreport https://github.com/mitchellh/vagrant/issues/1673
using 'bash -c 'BASH_ENV=/etc/profile exec bash'' as shell solves

Change-Id: I4aa8b51545f881e548830f91d5b5c543bd6ef613
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Resolve Vagrant issue 1673

When using the shell or puppet provisionier with Ubuntu there is
always an error message 'stdin: is not a tty'. According to the
bugreport https://github.com/mitchellh/vagrant/issues/1673
using 'bash -c 'BASH_ENV=/etc/profile exec bash'' as shell solves
this issue.

Change-Id: I4aa8b51545f881e548830f91d5b5c543bd6ef613

commit_message:
Enfore the used Vagrantfile API/syntax version when not initialised

If there is no base Vagrantfile (~/.vagrant.d/Vagrantfile) it's not
possible to start the box because VAGRANTFILE_API_VERSION is not
initialised by default.

Initializing VAGRANTFILE_API_VERSION when not set will resolve the
following issue: "uninitialized constant VAGRANTFILE_API_VERSION".

Change-Id: Ic3dc7b7e78b2634ad902a713cdac02ace71dce1d

commit_message:
Added ability to create security group automatically

Added ability to ask Sahara to create security group for node group. Feature
is only implemented in vanilla plugin 1.2.1 so far.

Partially implements: blueprint cluster-secgroups

Change-Id: I21d0196396bb966fe3d88f5445e98aebe90ad94b

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-21 05:00:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Look for and process sem-ver pseudo headers in git

At the moment careful changelog review is needed by humands to
determine the next version number. Semantic versioning means that all
we need to know to get a reasonable default next version (and a lower
bound on the next version) is a record of bugfix/deprecation/feature
work and api-breaking commits. In this patch we start scanning for
such headers from the git history to remove this burden from
developers/project release managers. Higher versions can of course
be used either via pre-versioning or by tagging the desired version.

implements: blueprint pbr-semver
sem-ver: feature
Change-Id: Id5e8cd723d5186d1bd8c01599eae8933e6f7ea6d

determine the next version number. Semantic versioning means that all
we need to know to get a reasonable default next version (and a lower
bound on the next version) is a record of bugfix/deprecation/feature
work and api-breaking commits. In this patch we start scanning for
such headers from the git history to remove this burden from
developers/project release managers. Higher versions can of course
be used either via pre-versioning or by tagging the desired version.

commit_message:
Look for and process sem-ver pseudo headers in git

At the moment careful changelog review is needed by humans to
determine the next version number. Semantic versioning means that all
we need to know to get a reasonable default next version (and a lower
bound on the next version) is a record of bugfix/deprecation/feature
work and api-breaking commits. In this patch we start scanning for
such headers from the git history to remove this burden from
developers/project release managers. Higher versions can of course
be used either via pre-versioning or by tagging the desired version.

implements: blueprint pbr-semver
sem-ver: feature
Change-Id: Id5e8cd723d5186d1bd8c01599eae8933e6f7ea6d

commit_message:
Add notifications to Sahara

Added following notifications to Sahara:
 * Notification about creating cluster
 * Notification about deleting cluster
 * Notification about updating cluster status

Added unit tests for messaging and notify functions
Docs updated

Partially implement: blueprint ceilometer-integration

Change-Id: I7add0e477ab16f189c533857ad6a158ee41242de

commit_message:
make backup_incremental_strategy a datastore specific option

backup_incremental_strategy remained a common option even after
backup_strategy became a datastore specific option. This change moves
backup_incremental_strategy to a datastore specific option with the
appropriate decorations for deprecation.

Change-Id: I6113ae9aede6b2c9cb960320e05960df2de34566
Closes-Bug: #1354959

When configuring Mariadb we should always auto-start the
Mariadb (or mysql) daemon on startup. This prevents breaking simple
use cases like rebooting nodes, etc.

This patch updates the mariadb-rpm element to autostart mariadb.

The mariadb element is also updated to autostart 'mysql' (which

commit_message:
mariadb: call os-svc-enable

When configuring Mariadb we should always auto-start the
Mariadb (or mysql) daemon on startup. This prevents breaking simple
use cases like rebooting nodes, etc.

This patch updates the mariadb-rpm element to autostart mariadb.

The mariadb element is also updated to autostart 'mysql' (which
is the service name that element uses instead).

Change-Id: I02ccead89ce5054557a7037cbf127cbe6e75425b

commit_message:
py3: Use six module for StringIO imports

It is python 2/3 compatibility change.
six.StringIO an alias for StringIO.StringIO in Python 2 and
io.StringIO in Python 3.

Partially implements blueprint py3-compatibility

Change-Id: Ib2f570645d3b0a4b3bd38c017693e0b1b77f3236

commit_message:
Fix minor issues in the DRAC driver

This is a following patch of 2eb3c12ce3fb2b2eb4408367f2c950724a098d93. The
issues this patch fixes are:

* Put the ReturnValue constants in a common place so it can be used by
  the power and management interfaces code.
* Move the filter object creation to inside the client. This also adds
  a new exception DracInvalidFilterDialect which is raised if when an
  invalid filter dialect is specified.
* Fix the docstring of the find_xml method to reflect the values returned
  in case an element is not found.
* Move the helper test function _mock_wsman_root() to a common place
  and update tests to use it.

Change-Id: Iefc3993f61e32a3a50faf4b9bd80aaab6ae1d3bf

commit_message:
Implement claim and message expiration logic for Redis

This patch uses Redis where possible to automatically expire
claim and message data. Where it is not possible, manual
GC functions have been added in order to iterate through the
remaining data and clean it up.

Note that this patch does not include an implementation for
a command script that will call the Redis drivers' GC
method. That will be done in a followup patch.

Also, the GC functions in this patch do not decrement the
stats counters, since those are actually removed in the next
patch.

This change has been tested locally on my box using the
ZAQAR_TEST_REDIS=1 flag.

Change-Id: I38bfc52cf2de0ed078478aca80e6ad56b5bd55aa
Partially-Implements: blueprint redis-storage-driver

commit_message:
Cleaned up sample trove-guestagent.conf

Cleaned out the trove-guestagent.conf to only contain values that make
sense for the guest agent. There were also values that were different
between the sample conf, and the defaults in cfg.py, which were fixed
to be consistent, so as to have a single set of sane defaults.

Closes bug: 1336618

Change-Id: Ib3823856c288971665fa29489c4ffc5b899ccbaf

commit_message:
Allow worker count to be specified when no executor provided

When a multi-threaded engine is used it is nice to be able
to inform the engine how many workers should be created when
it creates its own executor. To allow this to be possible accept
a new keywork argument that can be used to set this value.

Change-Id: I0095d548249372440abbcf9b5c3b8fa841ca0ea9

commit_message:
Address some potential security issues in lockutils

Adds a note to the lock_path help text explaining how to secure the
target directory.  Also opens lock files in append mode so there is
no possibility of overwriting a file due to a malicious symlink.

Change-Id: I77b72b20088fe66b573c23bd1fd98376c2b0f168

commit_message:
Reduce boilerplate code using get_client_manager

There are a few Tempest tests that contain boilerplate code used
to create an Openstack manager client. This commit removes this
boilerplate code with the following changes:

1. BaseTestCase.get_client_manager now generates different
   credentials based on the type of user type passed in. There
   are also optional keyword arguments to control the type of
   manager to be instantiate as well as an alternate manager type
   in case tenant isolation is disabled.

2. Updated the test that was using tenant isolation to use the
   updated get_client_manager method

Change-Id: I5c73cb8db96c0e1e97a553404d484996ff7bbf2c
Closes-Bug: #1246932

subject: Upgrades, don't kill new containers during the upgrade
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7195, 'name': 'Matthew Mosesohn', 'email': 'raytrac3r@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmosesohn'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-02 15:54:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Upgrades, don't kill new containers during the upgrade

Stopping of new containers during the upgrade
leads to a lot of errors and raise conditions.
In the same time containers should be run under
supervisor because we need to store logs.

Rewrote upgrade flow:

* stop old containers
* upload the images
* generate supervisor config with autostart False,
  it allows to prevent supervisor to run containers
* run containers in method `create_and_start_new_containers`
  one by one in right order
* regenerate configs for supervisor with autostart
  True, to start all of the containers after supervisor
  restart
* verify containers

How it helps?

* there was race condition when we were running
  services via supervisor and iptables cleaning
  at the same time, supervisor not always was
  able to start all containers, as result we
  could get nat rules with the same port but
  different ip addresses
* containers stopping could interrupt non-atomic
  actions, like db migration in keystone container
* since we run container one by one, we will not
  be able to get problem with ip duplication,
  during the upgrade

Related-bug: #1357357
Related-bug: #1364087
Closes-bug: #1364054
Change-Id: I86accb8b2c2fc5a15425e32838a58c9b45022d8d
