commit_message:
Upgrades, don't kill new containers during the upgrade

Stopping of new containers during the upgrade
leads to a lot of errors and raise conditions.
At the same time containers should be run under
supervisor because we need to store logs.

Rewrote upgrade flow:

* stop old containers
* upload the images
* generate supervisor config with autostart False,
  it allows to prevent supervisor to run containers
* run containers in method `create_and_start_new_containers`
  one by one in right order
* regenerate configs for supervisor with autostart
  True, to start all of the containers after supervisor
  restart
* verify containers

How it helps:

* there was race condition when we were running
  services via supervisor and iptables cleaning
  at the same time, supervisor not always was
  able to start all containers, as result we
  could get nat rules with the same port but
  different ip addresses
* containers stopping could interrupt non-atomic
  actions, like db migration in keystone container
* since we run container one by one, we will not
  be able to get problem with ip duplication,
  during the upgrade

Related-bug: #1357357
Related-bug: #1364087
Closes-bug: #1364054
Change-Id: I86accb8b2c2fc5a15425e32838a58c9b45022d8d

commit_message:
addCleanup is missing in create snapshot test

This patch adds "addCleanup" to the create snapshot test.
Without this, the test won't wait for a successful delete snapshot
to complete and causes failure when delete volume happens.

CCLA SCHEDULE B SUBMISSION

Change-Id: I3d7ebfa24c14aa7cafb10e8ee5313bb3d4bce978
Closes-Bug: 1351441

(This is split out from I24461f4328e188c8983ad574495e11e033ec5ba4 on
neutron, which was a hunt to remove "PRED and A or B" deprecated ternary
idiom.)

int(bool) already returns only 1 or 0 - no need to do our own explicit

Change-Id: Ib482d6cb63ece7e1d5073fa7dc1c7daf9db8a0b3
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Just use int(BOOL) to convert to 1 or 0

(This is split out from I24461f4328e188c8983ad574495e11e033ec5ba4 on
neutron, which was a hunt to remove "PRED and A or B" deprecated ternary
idiom.)

int(bool) already returns only 1 or 0 - no need to do our own explicit
version.

Change-Id: Ib482d6cb63ece7e1d5073fa7dc1c7daf9db8a0b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-26 01:28:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.ssh_execute(),
the exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception. A test case has been added to ensure that all three are
properly masked.

An earlier commit (e8199714) failed to address ssh_execute(). This
change set addresses ssh_execute.

OSSA is aware of this change request.

Change-Id: I0db9e98cbeb2a5e6f9ae0074f24717aa91cfc238
Closes-Bug: #1343604

commit_message:
Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.ssh_execute(),
the exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception. A test case has been added to ensure that all three are
properly masked.

An earlier commit (e8199714) failed to address ssh_execute(). This
change set addresses ssh_execute.

OSSA is aware of this change request.

Change-Id: I0db9e98cbeb2a5e6f9ae0074f24717aa91cfc238
Closes-Bug: #1343604

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-16 21:03:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixed restore to work with newer pexpect

Fixed an issue with restore where it was failing with pexpect 3.2.
pexpect now actually attempts to stop the temp mysqld process (as
opposed to the earlier behavior of only closing file descriptors)
which fails due to a difference in privilege level (since the
process was run with sudo). We now use mysqladmin shutdown to stop
the temp mysqld process.

Change-Id: Iba81648bb1654db97de876dd9a0dbfb04b8811d1

commit_message:
Fixed restore to work correctly with pexpect

Fixed an issue with restore where it was failing with the latest
version of pexpect in Ubuntu 14.04.

pexpect attempts to stop the temp mysqld process which fails due to
a difference in privilege level (since the process was run with sudo).
We now use mysqladmin shutdown to stop the temp mysqld process.

Closes-Bug: 1343344

commit_message:
Refactoring to reduce noise in log files

Currently lot of unnecessary log lines are generated during API
invocation and image transfer. This patch makes log printing
statement changes to reduce noise in log files.

Change-Id: Ifdd43a9d1d32cb6d8957b9805b56729eb9270daf

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-14 20:38:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cisco VPN with in-band CSR (interim solution)

Currently, the Cisco VPN drivers use two routers for the proof of concept
solution. A Neutron router provides access to the public and private
subnets, and a Cisco CSR (out-of-band) provides the VPN tunneling.

The end goal is to integrate the Cisco VPN drivers with the Cisco L3
routing plugin being developed (as a separate blueprint), allowing an
in-band CSR to be used as a Neutron router for VPN functionality.

This commit provides an incremental approach to that goal, by modifying
the Cisco VPN drivers to be able to dynamically obtain CSR info from
an INI file, instead of statically reading the INI file at start-up.

A CSR VM can be created out-of-band (or in-band using Nova) and the INI
file can be updated with the router info. Then, the Cisco VPN driver
can use that information (dynamically) to create IPSec connections.

Once the Cisco L3 router plugin is available, the INI file will be
removed, and two calls to the plugin will be used to obtain the needed
router information, for an integrated solution.

The main advantages are:
    - Dynamically use the CSR for VPN.
    - Less manual intervention and setup.
    - Easy migration to final solution.
    - No dependency on the Cisco L3 router plugin implementation.

Note 1: The INI unit tests are moved from device driver to service
        driver and modified.

Note 2: I added a unit test for deleting IPSec site-to-site connection,
        which was missing (pass).

Note 3: For more details on the change, you can view this Google Doc:
        http://goo.gl/DXir8c

Change-Id: I307fc79952e3e12a0f77679ac1fc2b314fa63684
Partially-Implements: blueprint cisco-vpnaas-with-cisco-csr-router

commit_message:
Cisco VPN with in-band CSR (interim solution)

Currently, the Cisco VPN drivers use two routers for the proof of concept
solution. A Neutron router provides access to the public and private
subnets, and a Cisco CSR (out-of-band) provides the VPN tunneling.

The end goal is to integrate the Cisco VPN drivers with the Cisco L3
routing plugin being developed (as a separate blueprint), allowing an
in-band CSR to be used as a Neutron router for VPN functionality.

This commit provides an incremental approach to that goal, by modifying
the Cisco VPN drivers to be able to dynamically obtain CSR info from
an INI file, instead of statically reading the INI file at start-up.

A CSR VM can be created out-of-band (or in-band using Nova) and the INI
file can be updated with the router info. Then, the Cisco VPN driver
can use that information (dynamically) to create IPSec connections.

Once the Cisco L3 router plugin is available, the INI file will be
removed, and two calls to the plugin will be used to obtain the needed
router information, for an integrated solution.

The main advantages are:
    - Dynamically use the CSR for VPN.
    - Less manual intervention and setup.
    - Easy migration to final solution.
    - No dependency on the Cisco L3 router plugin implementation.

Note 1: The INI unit tests are moved from device driver to service
        driver and modified.

Note 2: I added a unit test for deleting IPSec site-to-site connection,
        which was missing (pass).

Note 3: For more details on the change, you can view this Google Doc:
        http://goo.gl/DXir8c

Change-Id: I307fc79952e3e12a0f77679ac1fc2b314fa63684
Partially-Implements: blueprint cisco-vpnaas-with-cisco-csr-router

Explicitly tell source-repositories which revision of a project to pull
in, source-repositories by default pulls in "master", which is ok for
all projects except the one we actually want to test (devstack-gate
leaves the commit we want checked out in a detached head).

commit_message:
Explicitly set DIB_REPOREF_*

Explicitly tell source-repositories which revision of a project to pull
in, source-repositories by default pulls in "master", which is ok for
all projects except the one we actually want to test (devstack-gate
leaves the commit we want checked out in a detached head).

Upto now we haven't been testing the correct version of most of the
commits in the experimental queue.

Change-Id: Ibb4be09b22179d62c9d6f0afb2525c521bb3f36d
Closes-Bug: #1364345

commit_message:
Sahara clusters networking parameters

Added support for floating_ip_pool and neutron_management_network
parameters. These parameters will allow to becnchmark Sahara in all
network configurations.

Change-Id: I17c601695a38ed01c6e932b3c18fefe6bee703c7

commit_message:
Enable H202, H402, H404 rules

* H202 assertRaises Exception too broad
* H402 one line docstring needs punctuation
* H404 multi line docstring should start without a leading new line

Change-Id: I2f662b8b97d14daa501620c8237bf93bd2251243

commit_message:
Make log level in linux.utils.execute configurable

Function linux.utils.execute always logs failures on error level.
Some callers use this function to check resource existance and
interpret failure as normal flow. Log level is made configurable
for such cases.

Change-Id: I8e4cd7b42234426f8fe58d353a64e898f02f8998
Closes-bug: 1339045

commit_message:
Extend software_configs API for SoftwareComponent

This patch extends the software_configs API backend to support multiple
'configs' in one resource, as it is the case for the new
OS::Heat::SoftwareComponent resource type that is derived from
OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig.

Change-Id: Ie16d281aed364e45456296d95606037d54df9651
Implements: partial-blueprint action-aware-sw-config

commit_message:
Remove localboot provides.

The current element-provides points to localboot
which results in error. Removing it to make it work
as its not needed at all.

Change-Id: I506fbf460fad46aa9b9ba6dd82fb7524894bbbe7

commit_message:
Create files in bootstrap as owner root

Logrotate will not work if its config is
owned by non-root user.

Change-Id: I12fcf970f3e843e92215b19ab651af4dd8a5e48e
Closes-Bug: #1364083

commit_message:
Add send-data-to-ceilometer support for pxe_ipminative driver

This patch will implement pxe_ipminative driver *get_sensors_data* method to get
sensor data by pyghmi get_sensor_data() method call.

Spec:
https://github.com/openstack/ironic-specs/blob/master/specs/juno/send-data-to-ceilometer.rst

Related patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/72538/

Change-Id: I2368e78e39970b7a3cffe3d8cb2dd3fce5056635

commit_message:
Set no-quorum-policy using cibadmin patch

Pacemaker crmsh utility may sometimes fail
when trying to set no-quorum policy as
xml-diff becomes outdated.

This approach uses cibadmin patch option
that applies xml diff cleanly.

Change-Id: I63297d33ab20c7dd48ffa5064a981d6555c6b502
Closes-bug: #1363908

commit_message:
Use __qualname__ where appropriate

The __qualname__ attribute simplifies the determination
of an objects class name and callable name and is useful
in python 3.x to be able to use since it can correctly
identify names better than the python 2.x __name__ attribute
can.

Adds a few tests in to ensure that the usage of __qualname__
where available functions as expected.

See: http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3155/

Fixes bug 1341441

Change-Id: Ic6942cbbc8e35d65fb3ac603ff1dfc8e20c194a3

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2014-07-23 18:14:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a check_telemetry method to javelin

Adds simple queries of the telemetry service to allow checks that meter
data effectively survives an upgrade. The checks make the perhaps
not robust assumption that there will be at least two samples (per
query) and that the first one comes from before the upgrade and the
last one comes from after the upgrade.

This can be made more robust with some awareness of time. That is:
If we know that the upgrade process will last at least N seconds
we can look for that gap in the samples to confirm that earlier
samples are substantially older than the current time or the
time on the more recent samples.

Question:
* How do we get awareness of time?

Partially implements: blueprint grenade-resource-survivability

Change-Id: Ie759d71326916d543c7b3603d8812306d093715a
', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2014-07-28 09:53:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a check_telemetry method to javelin

Adds simple queries of the telemetry service to allow checks that meter
data effectively survives an upgrade. At this time the tests
check the first and last samples in the database. This could be the
same sample.

Getting robust tests is challenging because check mode is run both
before and after the upgrade with the same tests.

Partially implements: blueprint grenade-resource-survivability

', 'number': 12}, {'created': '2014-08-10 21:35:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a check_telemetry method to javelin

Adds simple queries of the telemetry service that check that meter
data properly survives an upgrade. The code is written so it is
possible to make different queries before and after the upgrade.

UPGRADE_GAP provides a timedelta against which it should be
possible to declare that a sample comes before or after
JAVELIN_START (the time at which the javelin command was
called). This is done in an effort to avoid ambiguity of
sample data and race conditions with notifications made
by nova and polling done by the ceilometer compute agent.
This is not yet perfect: a better solution would involve
knowing the timestamp on the data-dumpfile made during
the upgrade process and using that a selector for timestamps.
We can only use JAVELIN_START to ensure that old samples are
in fact old. It does not work for new samples as the ceilometer
compute agent can produce samples at three distinct times:

* in the previous run (before the upgrade)
* in the new run before JAVELIN_START
* in the new run after JAVELIN_START (it takes a while for the
  agent to get rolling).

The latter possibility is covered by a loop which waits up to sixty
seconds for sensible polling data during check mode.

resources.yaml is changed so that the generated servers have
different owners and images as available factors to sample.

Partially implements: blueprint grenade-resource-survivability

For completeness the code will need to compare new samples against

Change-Id: Ie759d71326916d543c7b3603d8812306d093715a
', 'number': 16}, {'created': '2014-08-18 16:03:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a check_telemetry method to javelin

Adds simple queries of the telemetry service that check that meter
data properly survives an upgrade. The code is written so it is
possible to make different queries before and after the upgrade.

UPGRADE_GAP provides a timedelta against which it should be
possible to declare that a sample comes before or after
JAVELIN_START (the time at which the javelin command was
called). This is done in an effort to avoid ambiguity of
sample data and race conditions with notifications made
by nova and polling done by the ceilometer compute agent.
Since we can only use JAVELIN_START to ensure that old samples
are in fact old we also inspect the modified time on the ceilometer
data dump file and use that to compare new samples against it.

With these comparisons we can know that we have samples from before
and after the upgrade, still in the database.

Compute agent can produce samples at three distinct times:

* in the previous run (before the upgrade)
* in the new run before JAVELIN_START
* in the new run after JAVELIN_START (it takes a while for the
  agent to get rolling).

N.B: This currently cannot work and is expected to fail because
it relies on accessing information which grenade does not yet
provide to it.

Partially implements: blueprint grenade-resource-survivability

Change-Id: Ie759d71326916d543c7b3603d8812306d093715a

commit_message:
Add a check_telemetry method to javelin

Adds simple queries of the telemetry service that check that meter
data properly survives an upgrade.

JAVELIN_START is recorded to provide a way to confirm that the
oldest available data is from before the upgrade, thus confirming
that the data survived the upgrade.

Partially implements: blueprint grenade-resource-survivability

commit_message:
Migrate test_network_basic_ops to tempest clients

This patch migrates the network basic ops scenario tests
from official client to tempest clients.

manager:
Creates NeutronScenario subclass to enforce usage of neutron instead of nova
network. Overrides novanetwork helper methods from ancestor (such as secgroup
related methods). Class name is temporary since NetworkScenario is used by
non-migrated scenario. Will be changed to NetworkScenario once all network
tests have migrated

resources:
Creates DeletableResource module in services/network for resources using
the tempest clients. Copy of api/network/common. Original will be removed once
all related scenarios have migrated.
Changes __hash__ to use object's uuid instead of memory address.

network_basic_ops:
Changes references to server object to handle dict and scenarios keypair dict
to use key_name as keys instead of servers (since server is an unhashable dict)

Partially-implements: bp:tempest-client-scenarios

Change-Id: Id7341c662c0faad3ab0cb3fc1579326613ac9c68

subject: WIP to rationalize SQL in alignment with new schema
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 20:33:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP to rationalize SQL in alignment with new schema

This is just some exploration to see how much needs to change
to get simpler queries when using the new schema proposed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/111313/11

The primary insight here is that the scenario tests create
samples which are considered impossible in the "real" world.
Changing the tests (as done) allows more straightforward
queries of the resource and meter tables (and potentially
more, thus the WIP).

The mongo storage implementation works with _either_ these tests or
the unchanged tests because it only saves the most recent resource
representation anyway.

At the moment the only code-side change is get_meters of the sql-a
implementation. In that a subquery (present to duplicate the mongo
behavior) is removed and the sample table is joined. This leads to
a much simpler query plan with 3 tables instead of 5 or 6 tables,
duplicate tables or temporary tables involved. This ought to result
in much better reads when doing a meter-list, even when joining
the metadata tables.

NB: I have not yet performance tested these changes, only explored
the query plan. It is possible (but unlikely) that simple selects
using indexes will be slower than more complex queries, so we should
be sure to do real tests. The current query arrangement is one of
several options. In situations with more data one of those other
options may be better.

Nest steps (if any):

* try with lots of data, explore other options
* explore the other usual queries to see what additional simplifications
  are possible (if any)

Change-Id: I28db654fbfe5aa9809e3024770cf7182bcecc58e

commit_message:
WIP to rationalize SQL in alignment with new schema

This is just some exploration to see how much needs to change
to get simpler queries when using the new schema proposed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/111313/11

The primary insight here is that the scenario tests create
samples which are considered impossible in the "real" world.
Changing the tests (as done) allows more straightforward
queries of the resource and meter tables (and potentially
more, thus the WIP).

The mongo storage implementation works with _either_ these tests or
the unchanged tests because it only saves the most recent resource
representation anyway.

At the moment the only code-side change is get_meters of the sql-a
implementation. In that a subquery (present to duplicate the mongo
behavior) is removed and the sample table is joined. This leads to
a much simpler query plan with 3 tables instead of 5 or 6 tables,
duplicate tables or temporary tables involved. This ought to result
in much better reads when doing a meter-list, even when joining
the metadata tables.

Note that postgresql requires either many group by statements, or
a distinct(). mysql and sqlite do not.

NB: I have not yet performance tested these changes, only explored
the query plan. It is possible (but unlikely) that simple selects
using indexes will be slower than more complex queries, so we should
be sure to do real tests. The current query arrangement is one of
several options. In situations with more data one of those other
options may be better.

Next steps (if any):

* try with lots of data, explore other options
* explore event handling (other get_* methods already explored)

Change-Id: I28db654fbfe5aa9809e3024770cf7182bcecc58e

commit_message:
Convert migrate_server v3 plugin to v2.1

Changes required to have v3 plugin natively support
the v2 API.

The migrate_live action is reverted back to os-migrateLive

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

commit_message:
Call policy.init() once per API request

This patch changes the policy engine behaviour and the API base
controller in order to ensure policy.init is invoked only once
for each API request.
This will avoid issues arising from policy file updates during
API processing and speed up response generation for list operations,
by about 5%.

This patch also removes an obsolete TODO comment.

Change-Id: I108ebd26fccdea19cb00959f70d87c3bc1587df9
Closes-Bug: 1302611

commit_message:
console: add typed console objects

Adds typed console objects used by virt driver API to
return information about consoles.

Also updates virt drivers to use them.

Closes-Bug: #1361611

commit_message:
Transfer class LazyPluggable from nova to oslo.utils

Need to transfer code of class LazyPluggable to oslo.utils
because this code copied in different projects. Global
attribute CONF is now transmitted in __init__ function.
Also was written tests for this class.

Change-Id: I1c828b643408d9a458f2facdf7e07b4ca7dfb64a

subject: Keystone/LDAP integration
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-10 21:01:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'CONSER-10489 Keystone/LDAP integration

Provides keystone-ldap element which does the following:

1. Installs python-ldap module into Keystone virtual environment

2. Creates /etc/keystone/ldap.crt file which contans CA certificates
needed to connect to LDAP server. File content is expected to be
passed in as "keystone_ldap_cacertfile" field of $OVERCLOUD_EXTRA_CONFIG
variable.

Configuration settings related to LDAP are supposed to be set via
passthrough feature (i.e. injected into /etc/keystone/keystone.conf file
by setting "keystone" field of $OVERCLOUD_EXTRA_CONFIG env variable).

Change-Id: Ifcd403cff3a75a9926d2a4ee7d041ef9f3171ffb

commit_message:
Keystone/LDAP integration

Installs python-ldap and ldappool modules into Keystone virtual environment.

Configuration settings related to LDAP are supposed to be set via
passthrough feature (i.e. injected into /etc/keystone/keystone.conf file
by setting "keystone" field of $OVERCLOUD_EXTRA_CONFIG env variable).

Change-Id: Ifcd403cff3a75a9926d2a4ee7d041ef9f3171ffb

subject: Make m-shr more stable on start up
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-29 15:18:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make m-shr more stable on start up

When service m-shr is restarted it tries to ensure shares and its rules.
If some error appears whole service fails to start up.
Lets catch all exceptions, log them and let service start anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1351195
Change-Id: I979932b5a80ff2e1494c361887a1c1dea63daeb5

commit_message:
Make m-shr more stable on start up

When service m-shr is restarted it tries to ensure shares and its rules.
If some error appears whole service fails to start up.
Lets catch all exceptions, log them and let service start anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1351195
Change-Id: I979932b5a80ff2e1494c361887a1c1dea63daeb5

commit_message:
Fix scheduled share creation with generic driver

Generic driver uses separate module service_instance for handling of Nova VMs.
If service m-shr starts and there are existing scheduled shares for creation,
then concurrent issue appears between method 'do_setup', that is called once
on start of service and 'ensure_server', that uses stuff from do_setup.

Main error is in following:
- "Returning exception 'GenericShareDriver' object has no attribute
  'service_instance_manager' to caller"

Changes:
- moved definition of attr 'service_instance_manager' to __init__ method.
- removed attrs '_helpers' and 'share_networks_servers' from
  ServiceInstanceManager as they are redundant.
- updated unittests according to changes.
- used direct import of 'constants' submodule for neutron api,
  to be able to access it on driver init step.
- replaced generic driver with common driver interface for inheritance
  by fake driver for unittests.

Change-Id: I0fe7f097dc03eade5e0d4dfdbda0eb49588f4dde
Closes-Bug: #1362985
Related-Bug: #1330391

commit_message:
Use oslo.serialization

Use jsonutils from lib oslo.serialization instead of
common code.
Module jsonutils from common code in nova can't be removed right
now due to the usage in other common modules. This should
be done after switching oslo code to use serialization library.

Also added hacking check for using jsonutils from oslo.serialization
library

Change-Id: I0d97f9faff081b572075a3b7aca042f9aeb948ae

commit_message:
On ubuntu break app logs into their own files

Currently on ubuntu we are sending all app logs to syslog which munges
them all together into /var/log/syslog. This makes debugging a somewhat
painful experience.

Change-Id: I89f9ddc168f08b90cece7cf5af2e032b2c4f5371

commit_message:
Initial translation setup

To start translation, we need to initially import the
translation file - and place it at the proper place so that
the usual CI scripts can handle it.

The proper place is for all python projects
$PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg.

Further imports of the pot files and its translations
will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot in a daily job.

Change-Id: Ic39a4cfe40ccdff4d6a299189fcfc0e6a9ec9c61

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-19 10:33:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Switch partitioned alarm evaluation to a hash-based approach

Short version: make use of the new distributed workload partitioning
utilities in Ceilometer to simplify the alarm evaluation
partitioning.

Longer version:
The assignment of alarms to individual partitioned alarm evaluators
now follows the same pattern as the division of resources between
scaled-out central agents.

The evaluators each join a tooz group and emit a periodic heartbeat
to tooz. Tooz provides distributed group membership information.

Thus the set of evaluators share minimal knowledge, but this is
sufficient to guide a hash-based approach to determining whether
an individual alarm UUID falls under the responsibility of an
individual evaluator.

The current RPC-fanout-based presence reporting and the master/slave
division of responsibilities can be dropped. Also the rebalancing
logic when a certain threshold of alarm deletion is crossed is no
longer be required.

Change-Id: Ica8dae569f9ff1c2f8fe58be6ae2def66be0da54
Implements: blueprint hash-based-alarm-partitioning

commit_message:
Switch partitioned alarm evaluation to a hash-based approach

Short version: make use of the new distributed workload partitioning
utilities in Ceilometer to simplify the alarm evaluation
partitioning. Code is intentionally non-consolidated to enable
easy deletion of 'singleton' and 'partitioned' services in the Kilo
cycle.

Longer version:
The assignment of alarms to individual partitioned alarm evaluators
now follows the same pattern as the division of resources between
scaled-out central agents.

The evaluators each join a tooz group and emit a periodic heartbeat
to tooz. Tooz provides distributed group membership information.

Thus the set of evaluators share minimal knowledge, but this is
sufficient to guide a hash-based approach to determining whether
an individual alarm UUID falls under the responsibility of an
individual evaluator.

The current RPC-fanout-based presence reporting and the master/slave
division of responsibilities can be dropped in the next cycle.
Also the rebalancing logic when a certain threshold of alarm
deletion is crossed will no longer be required.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ica8dae569f9ff1c2f8fe58be6ae2def66be0da54
Implements: blueprint hash-based-alarm-partitioning

   task has on-error or on-finish property
 * Fix wait_success method in functional tests

I6ea61a3cc441dd1ca2ced7e2fd837a55b917f76d .

There are a some projects not listed in projects.txt that still have the

commit_message:
Remove docutils-pin

This was added to work around bug 1091333.  A new sphinx has been
released and so this is no longer necessary.

The docutils-pin has been removed from all projects listed
in projects.txt.
The patches removing the pin have used the IDs
I99ae8f8be1aa19508af05f2f72dea89537478f2f and
I6ea61a3cc441dd1ca2ced7e2fd837a55b917f76d .

There are a some projects not listed in projects.txt that still have the
docutils-pin, patches for these are under review.

Change-Id: Ic3208d181c0bdb4521ee2b062d8414ef7ac33230
Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <jeblair@hp.com>

ML2: Make get_device_details report mac address as well

This will be used by ofagent to route packets to local VMs.

Partially-implements: blueprint ofagent-merge-bridges
Change-Id: Icaa26448a370dd75d09e95ed439df5b486a862cf

commit_message:
Remove unneeded device_owner field from l2pop tuple

The DVR development added this device_owner to the middle of this
tuple during early development because it was thought to be needed.
Over the course of development, it was found to be unnecessary and
much of the code that read it from this value was removed or
obsoleted.  That job went unfinished and so this commit completes it.
This essentially restores the code to what it was before and fixes the
regression that was caused.

Change-Id: Ia901f925883b53e9880dd25688e16e0ffe402bf4
Partial-bug: #1352801

After another bug report about configuring dashboard sessions
using the installation guide, I decided to update the Icehouse
version to reference the Cloud Administrator Guide similar to the
Juno version.

[{'created': '2014-06-20 06:15:09.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Use openstack.common.lockutils module for locks in tox functional tests.

Tox test has been switched to use openstack.common.lockutils module
for interprocess locks. However neutron tox functional tests was
left behind probably because locking is not required by the existing
functional test cases. This change makes neutron tox functional tests
adopt openstack.common.lockutils for locking.

Closes-Bug: 1332380
Change-Id: I4d6076e5f7586a11ea5381f18774d4bab57b0081
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use openstack.common.lockutils module for locks in tox functional tests.

Tox test has been switched to use openstack.common.lockutils module
for interprocess locks. However neutron tox functional tests was
left behind probably because locking is not required by the existing
functional test cases. This change makes neutron tox functional tests
adopt openstack.common.lockutils for locking.

Closes-Bug: 1332380
Change-Id: I4d6076e5f7586a11ea5381f18774d4bab57b0081

commit_message:
Proper validation for inserting firewall rule

Say rule r2 is associated with policy p2. If user tries to insert rule r1
into a policy p1 before/after r2, error should be thrown saying that rule
r2 is not associated with policy p1.

Change-Id: Ifa415acc9533b7a323f966ee42d476460e68c9d3
Closes-bug: 1330898

commit_message:
Adding new methods to DB API v2 (load_xxx and create_or_update_xxx)

* Methods load_xxx() which can return None unlike get_xxx()
* Methods create_or_update_xxx()
* Unit tests for new methods
* Refactoring DB tests

Change-Id: Ieb1985d0a9cf70b41a166a4f97251dd5c108576c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 11:07:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Made provision for glance service to use Launcher

After sending SIGHUP signal to glance-service parent process,
it will call SIGHUP callback handler and then throws OSError.
The OSError is thrown because os.wait system call was
interrupted due to SIGHUP callback handler. As a result of
this parent process closes the server socket.
All child processes also gets terminated without completing
existing api requests because the server socket is already
closed and the service doesn't restart.

Added service module, launcher and common service module with
its dependencies from oslo-incubator in glance service.

After modifying the implemenatation, glance-service is able to
restart on sending SIGHUP signal to parent process and also
completing existing api requests.

Made provision to pass default hub to eventlet.hubs.use_hub()
in oslo-incubator common service famework. Defined new configuration
parameter 'eventlet_hub' with default value as 'poll' in glance.cmd.api
and glance.cmd.registry  and leveraged same to service framework of
oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I8fe08d2ee3fb2f29e7cffe04514866f8e9bb1933
blueprint:use-common-service-framework

commit_message:
Made provision for glance service to use Launcher

After sending SIGHUP signal to glance-service parent process,
it will call SIGHUP callback handler and then throws OSError.
The OSError is thrown because os.wait system call was
interrupted due to SIGHUP callback handler. As a result of
this parent process closes the server socket.
All child processes also gets terminated without completing
existing api requests because the server socket is already
closed and the service doesn't restart.

Added service module, launcher and common service module with
its dependencies from oslo-incubator in glance service.

After modifying the implemenatation, glance-service is able to
restart on sending SIGHUP signal to parent process and also
completing existing api requests.

Made provision to pass default hub to eventlet.hubs.use_hub()
in oslo-incubator common service framework. Defined new configuration
parameter 'eventlet_hub' with default value as 'poll' in glance.cmd.api
and glance.cmd.registry  and leveraged same to service framework of
oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I8fe08d2ee3fb2f29e7cffe04514866f8e9bb1933
blueprint:use-common-service-framework

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-16 05:01:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix "mutbale" object as default value

This patch fix the coding issue where "mutable" objects like list, dict
are being used as default value of param.

Currently there might be no scenario where "mutable" object as default value
create issue (as they maintain the state across function call) but in future
function can be called which can create the issue.

Those needs to be replace by taking default value as 'None' and have
if else condition accordingly in function def.

Change-Id: I251b316ef6d37f4b95c5e8d73a20a39005c22870
Closes-Bug: #1330322
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-06-16 09:33:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix "mutbale" object as default value

This patch fix the coding issue where "mutable" objects like list, dict
are being used as default value of param.

Current functions with mutable object as default value can create issues
if they will be called in more random order.
For example - first call with non default value and then with default
value. In this case original default will be overridden by the first
function call (as mutable object keep their state among function calls).

Such param's default value needs to be replace by 'None' and have
if else condition accordingly in function def.

Closes-Bug: #1330322

Change-Id: I251b316ef6d37f4b95c5e8d73a20a39005c22870

commit_message:
Fix "mutable" object as default value

This patch fix the coding issue where "mutable" objects like list, dict
are being used as default value of param.

Current functions with mutable object as default value can create issues
if they will be called in more random order.
For example - first call with non default value and then with default
value. In this case original default will be overridden by the first
function call (as mutable object keep their state among function calls).

This commit also add the hacking check for the same and its
corresponding test.

Closes-Bug: #1330322

Change-Id: I251b316ef6d37f4b95c5e8d73a20a39005c22870

commit_message:
Increase cinder volumes hard disk size

Increases cinder volumes hard disk size to 4GB. 2GB was not sufficient
for creating multiple volumes at once.

Change-Id: Iae9a8a4f71a297f0bbf017b80011cb9cc6d517cb

commit_message:
Updates cinder to support additional image types

Only raw images can be converted to bootable volumes by cinder. For
converting additional image types, cinder needs 'qemu-img' which is
installed via 'qemu-utils' package. This patch adds the required
package to the cinder controller node.

Change-Id: I296649827165989381ac7ce623e7babd62f7063a

commit_message:
MLNX Agent: ensure removed ports get treated on resyncs

This patch ensures that removed ports will be cleaned up properly if exception
occurs in the daemon_loop.
It does the same for the mlnx-agent as was done for the lb-agent in
Ieada34ad315c0c29aa8462ebf041a448fde007b8.

Refactoring the daemon_loop and scan_ports in a way that -
If there's an exception, the ports that were flagged for cleaning will
be retreated in the following iteration,
unlike previous exception handling, where only existing ports
were treated in the following iteration.

Closes-Bug: 1287648
Change-Id: I3af505773aa3fdc0d17f2079ac1f1b3e93bb64a3
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-06-01 13:37:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'MLNX Agent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

This patch changes the way mlnx agent process port_update notifications.
It does the same for the mlnx agent as was done for the ovs-agent in
I219c6bdf63b0b5e945b655677f9e28fa591f03cd.
Processing a port_update notification directly in the RPC
call may cause competition with the main RPC loop.
To prevent this problem, the actual process of ports updates is done
in the main RPC loop, whereas the RPC call merely adds the updated
port MAC address to a set of updated ports.
port_update notifications received within a single main loop iteration
will be coalesced and processed only once.

Closes-Bug: 1279655
Change-Id: I63dda60cb3cf171e5e9111a1ecf95e45e1d86362
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>

', 'number': 12}, {'created': '2014-08-05 17:35:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'MLNX Agent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

This patch changes the way mlnx agent process port_update notifications.
It does the same for the mlnx agent as was done for the ovs-agent in
I219c6bdf63b0b5e945b655677f9e28fa591f03cd.
Processing a port_update notification directly in the RPC
call may cause competition with the main RPC loop.
To prevent this problem, the actual process of ports updates is done
in the main RPC loop, whereas the RPC call merely adds the updated
port MAC address to a set of updated ports.
port_update notifications received within a single main loop iteration
will be coalesced and processed only once.

commit_message:
MLNX Agent: Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

This patch changes the way mlnx agent process port_update notifications.
It does the same for the mlnx agent as was done for the ovs-agent in
I219c6bdf63b0b5e945b655677f9e28fa591f03cd.
Processing a port_update notification directly in the RPC
call may cause competition with the main RPC loop.
To prevent this problem, the actual process of ports updates is done
in the main RPC loop, whereas the RPC call merely adds the updated
port MAC address to a set of updated ports.
port_update notifications received within a single main loop iteration
will be coalesced and processed only once.

Closes-Bug: 1279655
Change-Id: I63dda60cb3cf171e5e9111a1ecf95e45e1d86362
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>

commit_message:
Refactor plugin setup helpers out of test.base

Helper methods for plugin and notification setup were previously
defined on neutron.tests.base.BaseTestCase.  The imports required to
support these helpers were preventing the api tests from consuming
tempest due to configuration conflicts that resulted between neutron
and tempest.  This change moves the helpers to a new module in
tests/unit so that BaseTestCase can be safely used across all types of
tests.

Partially-Implements: blueprint retargetable-functional-testing

Change-Id: I44251db399cd73390a9d1931a7f253662002ba10

commit_message:
InstanceNUMAToplogy object create remove uuid param

We can get this from the object attribute so no need to pass it in
explicitly.

We do not need to bump the version of the object as there is no code
calling it as of yet, so we do not have to support the broken method
interface until the next major version bump.

Change-Id: I96e1d958e907272d94d7ca6481592b79ea6b6397
Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement

commit_message:
Make location of saved credentials files customizable

Save undercloud/overcloud-passwords in $TRIPLEO_ROOT by default.
User can also specify the path by changing the parameters in
devtest_variables.

Change-Id: Ifca80a1d9bc9aff61aee8c70e67f59451d1bb55b

commit_message:
virt: setup TCP chardevice in libvirt driver

Setup the tcp chardevice in the libvirt driver based on the
configuration (if the serial consoles are enabled) and disable the
logging to a file since we have an interactive console.

A new image property is introduced: hw_serial_port_count
A new flavor extra spec is introduced: hw:serial_port_count

Co-Authored-By: Vladan Popovic <vpopovic@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Wells <iawells@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sushma Korati <sushma_korati@persistent.co.in>

DocImpact
Partial-Implements: blueprint serial-ports
Change-Id: Ic6d24e27d61f600a90ed8fccb525d8b82725903e

commit_message:
Change v3 version API to v2.1

This patch changes v3 version API to v2.1 and makes v2 unit tests
share between v2 and v2.1.
v2.1 API does not support XML format. Unit tests related to XML
don't work against v2.1.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I7abadb0c9082b9e90a98938967f0e27d1a2fa766

commit_message:
Use v2.1 URLs instead of v3 ones in API unit tests

Now v2.1 API unit tests use fake.wsgi_app_v3() and they specify v3 URLs.
This patch adds wsgi_app_v21() for using v2 URLs in v2.1 API tests and
changes URLs in unit tests.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I5cdd7dd1d435ab0e4e093168f01e96f8dac52e8c

commit_message:
Fix string concatenation

Translated strings should not be added with normal strings. This makes
translations harder and will be an error with oslo.i18n.

Change-Id: I1f0bdd022ff155ed85e98f27f21ec9eed870aa1c

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1 "create a server" API

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: Ic17d2227909c9180ca86c9d578dad4c73ec57dfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-12 03:49:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Expose blacklisting scaled items via merge.py.

I don't like putting these in as environment variables, but I
suspect the consistency with the matching scale variables outweighs
the rationalise-ui needs in the short term.

Change-Id: Ib11c9ab767a7632717cb0fb277dbbba7c98bd4ee

commit_message:
Expose blacklisting scaled items via merge.py.

I don't like putting these in as environment variables, but I
suspect the consistency with the matching scale variables outweighs
the rationalise-ui needs in the short term.

Change-Id: Ib11c9ab767a7632717cb0fb277dbbba7c98bd4ee

commit_message:
Adding firewall logging for instances.

Adding a new configuration switch that would allow, if set to true,
to log DROPped packet aimed at any instances by setting
the following boolean: log_dropped_traffic.

Change-Id: Id74e15788a14b08934c1ec2a19a29a492ccb970c

commit_message:
Convert multiple-create v3 plugin to v2.1

Changes required to have the multiple create v3 plugin natively
support the v2.1 API. The following Server creation parameters
are reverted:

os-multiple-create:min_count -> min_count
os-multiple-create:max_count -> max_count
os-multiple-create:return_reservation_id -> return_reservation_id

Removes min_count parameter for a test which should never have
been included but due to a gap in input validation was ignored.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ie435c357958066e9fde40eab54826261ee9d4226

subject: Fix Redis message controller getting stuck in while loop
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-02 16:14:18.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/queues/storage/base.py', 'zaqar/queues/storage/redis/messages.py'], 'message': 'Fix Redis message controller getting stuck in while loop

The Redis driver was getting stuck in a loop while trying to create
a claim. The root cause turned out to be some logic that was trying
to skip past all the claimed messages at the head of the queue, but
did not advance the offset if no unclaimed messages were found,
leading to a neverending loop.

Change-Id: I8d2e1a7820c30e92a63ed938013f0e69dff83b2f
Partially-Implements: blueprint redis-storage-driver
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix Redis message controller getting stuck in while loop

The Redis driver was getting stuck in a loop while trying to create
a claim. The root cause turned out to be some logic that was trying
to skip past all the claimed messages at the head of the queue, but
did not advance the offset if no unclaimed messages were found,
leading to a neverending loop.

Change-Id: I8d2e1a7820c30e92a63ed938013f0e69dff83b2f
Partially-Implements: blueprint redis-storage-driver

commit_message:
LBaaS: agent monitoring and instance rescheduling

For those lbaas drivers that manage physical loadbalancer devices
rather than processes (like HAProxy) it doesn't matter which exact agent
will perform actual managing. So in case one agent fails such
loadbalancer instances may be simply rescheduled to another agent.

Implements blueprint lbaas-ha-agent

Change-Id: I87d5f608b74ab4f1875b1a44108ba817daeb828a

commit_message:
Fix Permissions on Postgresql Elements

permissions need to be 0755 to be discoverable by the
diskimage-builder, otherwise they're skipped outright.

Change-Id: I3ba357559d3f7f9f1fdad830bab47fd805d50c7f
Closes-Bug: #1364679

commit_message:
Make a whole host of modules hacking 0.9.2 compliant

Global requirements has updating the version of hacking to a minimum of
0.9.2 and it has brought a whole slew of changes. This CR is to tackle a
bunch of small hacking violations.

Change-Id: Iae1d0f40d2a13bc31cf4e688bda85c0cfd36847b

commit_message:
Make Client-ID a required header

It was decided to make Client-ID a required header. This patch adds a
new `before hook` that enforces this new rule.

Partially-Implements blueprint: api-v1.1-header-changes

Change-Id: I7b20d56812a0dff4f8ed3e6da75b62ef7c0f307e

commit_message:
Add --exclude-dirs option

In some situations it may be desirable to rely on file discovery but
exclude files within some subdirectories (such as .tox/).

Change-Id: Ibe989d0c96e7827631201d88f024e3e3414254cf

commit_message:
Adds nova-idmapshift cli utility

nova-idmapshift will be used by the libvirt-lxc driver to
correctly shift ownership of instance rootfs for use with
user namespaces.

Partially implements: bp libvirt-lxc-user-namespaces

Change-Id: I9aee622cca4578149201f02d02231a7bd0cbe912

commit_message:
Windows Server image creation

This patch prepends a guide for building Windows images for KVM OpenStack
to the guide and retains the previous notes at the bottom of the doc.

Change-Id: I029a428055dab59ec0a09b12933d38cd4d209bc1

commit_message:
Fix setup.cfg so setup could succeed

Setup.cfg refers to one of the cisco config files which are missing
in the repository. Remove missing file from setup.cfg

Change-Id: I7e2b582437ba708c2e983bf9fb3d89c80dbafb78
Closes-Bug: #1364048

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-02 04:16:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog

Implements: blueprint metadata-schema-catalog

A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.
This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

WORK IN PROGRESS

Currently committed:
 - DB migrate repo version script for metadef tables
 - DB CRUD: namespaces, objects, tags, properties, resource_types.
 - DB functional tests: namespaces(CRUD)
 - In progress: namespaces query pagination

Change-Id: I01cc63df3d3abe383c94cfb54598868b4bb729bb

", 'number': 13}, {'created': '2014-08-05 08:22:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - DB

Implements: blueprint metadata-schema-catalog

A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.
This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

WORK IN PROGRESS

Currently committed:
 - DB migrate repo version script for metadef tables
 - DB CRUD: namespaces, objects, tags, properties, resource_types.
 - DB functional tests: namespaces(CRUD)
 - In progress: namespaces query pagination

commit_message:
Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - DB

Implements: blueprint metadata-schema-catalog

A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.

This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

Change-Id: I01cc63df3d3abe383c94cfb54598868b4bb729bb
DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Lakshmi N Sampath <lakshmi.sampath@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Wayne Okuma <wayne.okuma@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Travis Tripp <travis.tripp@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michal Jastrzebski <michal.jastrzebski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>

[{'created': '2014-09-01 16:09:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Aoid deadlock when logging network_info

_plug_vifs() and _unplug_vifs() in driver.py both log network_info

However network_info is not a simple structure, its a reference to
a wrapper class that wraps a green thread for async network
allocation. Accessing network_info forces a wait on the wrapped
thread (if the network allocation has not completed), which can lead
to a deadlock as follows:

Thread 1 (periodic task in Nova) has grabbed the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE
in update_available_resource, and is waiting for the IO thread lock in the
logging handle routine

Thread 2 (in the ironic driver) has grabbed the IO thread lock in the logging
handle routine and is waiting for the async network object to be ready so
_str_ can be called to finish formatting the log message

Thread 3 (which is doing the async network object allocation) wants to call
update_usage in the resource tracker, but that needs the
COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE which is held by the first thread

The problem is similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/71409
and the fix is simply to covert network info to a string before the call
to LOG()

Change-Id: I3b750ac386588d9235ff10a972b3ab1d8f45cf38
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-09-01 16:27:51.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py'], 'message': 'Avoid deadlock when logging network_info

Thread 1 (periodic task in Nova) has grabbed the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE
in update_available_resource, and is waiting for the IO thread lock in the
logging handle routine

Thread 2 (in the ironic driver) has grabbed the IO thread lock in the logging
handle routine and is waiting for the async network object to be ready so
_str_ can be called to finish formatting the log message

Thread 3 (which is doing the async network object allocation) wants to call
update_usage in the resource tracker, but that needs the
COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE which is held by the first thread

The problem is similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/71409
and the fix is simply to covert network info to a string before the call
to LOG()

Closes-Bug: 1364059
Co-authored-by: Michey Mehta michey.mehta@hp.com

Change-Id: I3b750ac386588d9235ff10a972b3ab1d8f45cf38

commit_message:
Avoid deadlock when logging network_info

_plug_vifs() and _unplug_vifs() in driver.py both log network_info

However network_info is not a simple structure, its a reference to
a wrapper class that wraps a green thread for async network
allocation. Accessing network_info forces a wait on the wrapped
thread (if the network allocation has not completed), which can lead
to a deadlock as follows:

Thread 1 (periodic task in Nova) has grabbed the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE
in update_available_resource, and is waiting for the IO thread lock in the
logging handle routine

Thread 2 (in the ironic driver) has grabbed the IO thread lock in the logging
handle routine and is waiting for the async network object to be ready so
_str_ can be called to finish formatting the log message

Thread 3 (which is doing the async network object allocation) wants to call
update_usage in the resource tracker, but that needs the
COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE which is held by the first thread

The problem is similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/71409
and the fix is simply to covert network info to a string before the call
to LOG()

Closes-Bug: 1364059
Co-authored-by: Michey Mehta michey.mehta@hp.com

Change-Id: I3b750ac386588d9235ff10a972b3ab1d8f45cf38

commit_message:
Add Font Awesome icons

This patch adds an xstatic-packaged font awesome icon font to Horizon.
We need it, because the font icons included in Bootstrap 3 are non-free
and are likely to be excluded from some distributions. It also has a much
richer set of icons to choose from.

Change-Id: I725e0d77d230c16c01971f9af0dc02eb5662154d
Partial-implements: blueprint bp/font-icons

commit_message:
Change v3 availability-zone API to v2.1

This patch changes v3 availability-zone API to v2.1 and makes v2
unit tests share between v2 and v2.1.

The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ifbd152e431d182a5ccabac7fcc84fcc8a2fc6e5a

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-15 19:13:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Bypass vCenter when uploading to datastores

The current implementation requires all the bits to go through
vCenter when uploading an image to the datastore: this is highly
inefficient, since it adds load to vCenter and makes the transfer
much slower.

This patch gives an alternative which consists in bypassing vCenter
by acquiring a ticket to directly http PUT to the ESX host.
If somehow it is not possible to get the ticket (for example if
vCenter version is less than 5.5), we fallback to the previous
implementation.

This code is used by Glance and Nova.

Change-Id: I3cab23736ee5da99917a6a9b80ad5bc3754b5216

commit_message:
Bypass vCenter when uploading to datastores

The current implementation requires all the bits to go through
vCenter when uploading an image to the datastore: this is highly
inefficient, since it adds load to vCenter and makes the transfer
much slower.

This patch gives an alternative which consists in bypassing vCenter
by acquiring a ticket to directly http PUT to the ESX host.
If somehow it is not possible to get the ticket (for example if
vCenter version is less than 5.5), we fallback to the previous
implementation.

This code is used by Glance and Nova.

Change-Id: I3cab23736ee5da99917a6a9b80ad5bc3754b5216

commit_message:
Zaqar configuration reference docs

This change adds the basic configuration reference
in the user guide.

It includes the document structure outline according
the OpenStack configuration reference standard and
a list of configuration options present in zaqar.conf
with a description of default values and value types.

Configuration option tables has been generated using
the autogenerate_config_docs tool in openstack-doc-tools
repo. Needed files to easier update this tables in the
near future are located in the autogen folder.

blueprint document-config-options

Change-Id: I17884400f711f6d2723b0774c20e7df4ffb0e812

commit_message:
Fix missing trailing commas for modal dialogs

Trailing commas were accidentally removed from the 'classes' attribute
of the table actions for the Create Property and the Create Volume Type
Extra Spec dialogs. This caused the dialogs to lose their modality.

This submit fixes the problem on the two dialogs. Also there're fixes
to correct the Cancel button on the Create Property and Edit Property

when Keystone is acting as a SAML2 Identity Provider.

commit_message:
Faster nova fixed key generation

Using bc 64 times in loop is too verbose and slow,
replacing the echo/bc loop with hexdump and urandom.

The hexdump approach is 75 times faster and
does not floods the debug logs.

Using the common function for generating,
this kind of string with lib/heat and by the read_password.

Change-Id: If6a86dfaf0c21e2635c6de0a7b96a8ed7ec5b507

commit_message:
Make X-Project-ID a required header

We decided to make X-Project-ID a required header for every request. If
not present, a 400 error should be raised.

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-25 02:03:24.000000000', 'files': ['Modulefile'], 'message': 'Updated Module File Dependencies

commit_message:
Updated Module File Dependencies

Previously, the Modulefile did not include Keystone.
This would cause the module to not install all necessary
dependencies for Heat services.  This patch allows Heat to have
consistent dependencies with other OpenStack services.

Change-Id: I1e34f88701523971d093c621748e974ef30843c6

commit_message:
Let update_available_resource hit slave

Deployments that have a slave_connection configured can offload
read queries generated by this periodic task there. For
deployments with no slave, behavior remains the same.

Change-Id: Ie663ccc4e3e4334af4bdf75a95689c41ecc959b9
Blueprint: juno-slaveification

commit_message:
Don't create _member_ role from puppet

The _member_ role is provided by db migration or is created
automatically when user is created. Creating role _member_ from
puppet causes it to have different id than the one specified in
member_role_id keystone config option.

Change-Id: I3f0102b184a484f5e5a85cadf26ed651829fbf8c

commit_message:
Extend/fix support for extlinux bootloader

Some extlinux packages install mbr.bin under /usr/lib/extlinux or
/usr/lib/EXTLINUX so tese directories need to be checked as well.
Also, there are packages that create a /boot/extlinux directory
which needs to be taken into account. Finally, commit
bccffc8bfdfea4c452a5558a27f4d16da9cab6c7 dropped the /boot prefix
from the kernel and initrd references in the ext/syslinux config
file which is simply a bug that needs fixing.

Change-Id: Idb071c9b18ff557b0f0f76d0d754536f2deca904
Closes-Bug: 1335042

subject: Run cinder-volume in active/passive mode for NFS backend
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 13:55:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Run cinder-volume in active/passive mode for NFS backend

Running multiple cinder-volume instances which access the same storage
is currently not supported and may cause data inconsistency.
This issue is discussed here:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1322190

Running cinder-volume service in active/passive mode seems to be
the only safe way when shared backend storage is used. Also
workaround with setting shared host is needed.

Of course in default no-HA setup each cinder-volume manages its
local volumes and none of the above is needed.

Depends on: Ib68a5d542620fadd2b93b87bf8b59115f4d7423c
Change-Id: Id8f5c33f63538a9be85a1434f36b0a840e0b8db9

commit_message:
Run cinder-volume in active/passive mode for NFS backend

Running multiple cinder-volume instances which access the same storage
is currently not supported and may cause data inconsistency.
This issue is discussed here:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1322190

Running cinder-volume service in active/passive mode seems to be
the only safe way when shared backend storage is used. Also
workaround with setting shared host is needed.

Of course in default no-HA setup each cinder-volume manages its
local volumes and none of the above is needed.

Change-Id: Id8f5c33f63538a9be85a1434f36b0a840e0b8db9

commit_message:
Implement GroupSet updatable for AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface

Implement the 'GroupSet' updatable for
AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface resource to be compatible
with AWSCloudFormation.

Change-Id: Ia92c6d2732fdafc659d1a9a1db01cb66be9a9bc0
Closes-Bug: #1334212

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-24 09:10:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Match tenant_id when name ambiguity in get_secgroup_uuids()

Neutron allows securityGroup creation with same name
between one/more users, and the admin roles can get/use
the other users' securityGroup. So if there are several
securityGroups return, we should match the one which is
belongs to the stack owner, and then to raise
'PhysicalResourceNameAmbiguity' exception if can't match.

Change-Id: Icb7eae35ba40a142a4d398b7c9d58c8483b9588e
Closes-Bug: #1348064

commit_message:
Match tenant_id when name ambiguity in get_secgroup_uuids()

Neutron allows securityGroup creation with same name
between one/more users, and the admin roles can get/use
the other users' securityGroup. So if there are several
securityGroups return, we should match the one which is
belongs to the stack owner, and then to raise
'PhysicalResourceNameAmbiguity' exception if can't match.

Change-Id: Icb7eae35ba40a142a4d398b7c9d58c8483b9588e
Closes-Bug: #1348064

commit_message:
Making a few modules hacking 0.9.2 compliant

Global requirements has updating the version of hacking to a minimum of
0.9.2 and it has brought a whole slew of changes. This is tackling five
modules which contain new violations.

commit_message:
Change | to > in templates.

Clint pointed out that | prevents things rendering properly on
arbitrarily wide screens. For most things that makes sense but it
doesn't for the JSON examples IMO so I didn't alter those.

Change-Id: Ifb7dcc265c225b000bd5d26500212d41ea0233c8

commit_message:
Add support for cert based access type

This patch adds support for cert based access type in Manila.
It introduces a new 'access_type' called 'cert' in access-allow API.
'access_to' argument passed by the user is the certificate's CN
(common name) to which access is allowed by the backend.

Per the Manila IRC discussions, the cert based trust setup between
instances and backend is out-of-band to Manila. See the log @
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/manila/2014/manila.2014-07-24-15.01.log.html
(15:27:19 onwards)

Partially-implements blueprint cert-based-access-type

Change-Id: Ib48430deccece66a740ce05471db70eaadf634b3

commit_message:
Cisco DFA ML2 Mechanism Driver

Part 1:
This commit contains changes to support ML2 mechanism driver for Cisco
DFA. For more details please see the blueprint which has more description and
link to document with requirements.

Part 2: Changes in OVS neutron agent.
(http://review.openstack.org/110065)

Part 3: DFA extension driver.
(http://review.openstack.org/111761)

Part 4: DFA config profile service plugin.
(http://review.openstack.org/111863)

Change-Id: Ib53b6705948e1ed75059b85d8809562d9bb63f65
Partially Implements: blueprint ml2-mechanism-driver-for-cisco-dfa

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-12 15:55:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move tests out of glance's package

In order for Glance to adopt glance.store, it is necessary to move the
tests out of the server. This is due to a tests discovery issue where it
finds in the local working copy but loads them from the installed
glance. Unfortunately, we can't use develop installs to test
Glance+glance.store due a bug in Python/setuptools where all packages in
a namespace have to be installed using the same method (either install
or develop).

Unittests loader issue: http://bugs.python.org/issue19352

Partially-Implements blueprint: create-store-package

Change-Id: I1e5de93709c3654b0c21957052df88430802ff8c

commit_message:
Move tests out of glance's package

In order for Glance to adopt glance.store, it is necessary to move the
tests out of the server. This is due to a tests discovery issue where it
finds in the local working copy but loads them from the installed
glance. Unfortunately, we can't use develop installs to test
Glance+glance.store due a bug in Python/setuptools where all packages in
a namespace have to be installed using the same method (either install
or develop).

Unittests loader issue: http://bugs.python.org/issue19352

Partially-Implements blueprint: create-store-package

Change-Id: I1e5de93709c3654b0c21957052df88430802ff8c

commit_message:
Make minor typo correction

from: openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-api.conf keystone_authtoken \
  auth_uri http://controller:5000

=>
openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-api.conf keystone_authtoken \
  auth_url http://controller:5000

Close-Bug: #1353635

Change-Id: I7c97b805695b011ce800c171d312b2a612bb4a9b

commit_message:
Fix dib-lint failures

As part of an ongoing effort to apply more testing against
elements, this patch provides fixes for most dib-lint
failures outside of the set -o pipefail patch[1] including
set options, indention, and file permissions.  There are
still a few indention errors left after this patch, but
they should be ignored in a dib-lint patch soon to add
additional exclusions.

[1] Ib97e3a35dd0ee653f1298c9ffe6ea99cea9dfd55

Change-Id: Ibf3dfc5735752900598466b0a54342692ef77284

commit_message:
First attempt at an angularJS workflow for launching heat stacks

  - replaces django multi-step form view with angular wizard
  - allows for multiple file uploads, client side file downloads
    (for file URLs), etc
  - requires a custom heatclient from here:
      o https://github.com/jsomara/python-heatclient/tree/envfiles
    if this becomes a blocking issue, we can add that method to horizon
    temporarily. The other possibility is that it is extended to support
    nested stacks as well (a Juno goal). This patch includes this code
    inside horizon, with the intention of removing it when support becomes
    available in upstream python-heatclient
  - there are outstanding messaging improvements (error messages, etc) that
    this patch could take advantage of for better message dialogs

To test this, check out sample environment & template files here. You'll
notice that the referenced file in the environment will get added in
stage2 of the wizard. If you don't have any file references to resolve,
it will go straight to stage3.
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example2_server_with_volume_nested/server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/env_server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/server_with_volume_env.yaml

Fixes-Bug: #1322258
Partial-Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/heat-nested-stack
Change-Id: If94430491955c3b0450d9c282d9899dda2568e92

subject: Error trapping for ldap2py
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-02 18:30:25.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py'], 'message': 'Error trapping for ldap2py

Closes-Bug: #1364521

I've recently come across a condition where the ldap driver will
return values from Active Directory which cannot be utf8 encoded.

Network captures show a clean attribute and value list, whereas if
I put in a debug statement to write out the values as
returned by the driver I can see a value like this:
?"?gZK??[J????

I propose that we drop values which cannot be encoded.

Change-Id: I81622f3f6e6d78d714fad05d22a75261aefc27f5
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Error trapping for ldap2py

Closes-Bug: #1364521

I've recently come across a condition where the ldap driver will
return values from Active Directory which cannot be utf8 encoded.

Network captures show a clean attribute and value list, whereas if
I put in a debug statement to write out the values as
returned by the driver I can see a value like this:
?"?gZK??[J????

I propose that we drop values which cannot be encoded.

Change-Id: I81622f3f6e6d78d714fad05d22a75261aefc27f5

commit_message:
Add hasrestart to some services

(5.0.X backport)
Hasrestart makes Puppet use restart instead of stop
and start to manage a service and many init scripts
would work better if used like this.

Change-Id: I7cee7cc4690b13d896775124ad00ebeba7daf68e
Closes-Bug: 1364119

commit_message:
Add hasrestart to some services

Hasrestart makes Puppet use restart instead of stop
and start to manage a service and many init scripts
would work better if used like this.

Change-Id: I9e8e86a1c5bf4bcac9683542e9cfb7ca3100c9e8
Closes-Bug: 1364119

commit_message:
labs: fix libguestfs-tools installation

Supply an answer for the debconf prompt during libguestfs-tools
installation. The current lack of such an answer results in warnings
about "Use of uninitialized value" or a hanging script.

commit_message:
Update installation guide for syslinux 6

Fedora 21 and the next Ubuntu will have syslinux 6 in them. In syslinux
6 modules are not "stand alone" as it was in versions prior to 4, see:
http://www.syslinux.org/wiki/index.php/Library_modules

Partial-Bug: #1351010
Change-Id: Ie6bb031c10a9f8cf978e2c5dbd643b4a19cc93d0

subject: correctly implement volumes_from property
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-01 15:34:53.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/heat_docker/heat_docker/resources/docker_container.py'], 'message': "correctly implement volumes_from property

The Docker plugin incorrectly implements the 'volumes_from' option:

- The property is marked as a string when it should be a list, and
- The property needs to be passed to start_container rather than
  create_container.

Change-Id: I617a4d29a9edbb45d80c7b8abb8f87eeaf795a8b
closes-bug: #1364041
closes-bug: #1364039
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
correctly implement volumes_from property

The Docker plugin incorrectly implements the 'volumes_from' option:

- The property is marked as a string when it should be a list, and
- The property needs to be passed to start_container rather than
  create_container.

Change-Id: I617a4d29a9edbb45d80c7b8abb8f87eeaf795a8b
closes-bug: #1364041
closes-bug: #1364039

subject: Temporarily pin requests<2.4.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-29 17:41:24.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Temporarily pin requests<2.4.0

Today's release of requests 2.4.0 has resulted in unit test issues
for horizon and python-keystoneclient, but the problem may be more
widespread. Since we're nearing an integrated release milestone,
it's pragmatic to pin this now and allow projects to work out their
compatibility bugs after the milestone.

Change-Id: Id5180803402d207d6e59610474c11c61622f6b5a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Temporarily pin requests<2.4.0

Today's release of requests 2.4.0 has resulted in unit test issues
for horizon and python-keystoneclient, but the problem may be more
widespread. Since we're nearing an integrated release milestone,
it's pragmatic to pin this now and allow projects to work out their
compatibility bugs after the milestone.

Change-Id: Id5180803402d207d6e59610474c11c61622f6b5a

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-18 07:35:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Deprecate cinder_* configuration settings

Create a new section in the configuration file called 'cinder'.
Move all of the glance_* configuration settings to this section.

DocImpact

The table below has the changes:

+---------------------------------+----------------------------+
| 'DEFAULT' Section               | 'cinder' Section           |
|---------------------------------|----------------------------|
| cinder_catalog_info             | catalog_info               |
| cinder_endpoint_template        | endpoint_template          |
| os_region_name                  | os_region_name             |
| cinder_ca_certificates_file     | ca_certificates_file       |
| cinder_http_retries             | http_retries               |
| cinder_http_timeout             | http_timeout               |
| cinder_api_insecure             | api_insecure               |
| cinder_cross_az_attach          | cross_az_attach            |
+---------------------------------+----------------------------+

UpgradeImpact
The changes are backward compatible.

Change-Id: Ie6b3f9d60b5e149375ff3039be444538f5f50756

commit_message:
Deprecate cinder_* configuration settings

Create a new section in the configuration file called 'cinder'.
Move all of the cinder_* configuration settings to this section.

DocImpact

The table below has the changes:

+---------------------------------+----------------------------+
| 'DEFAULT' Section               | 'cinder' Section           |
|---------------------------------|----------------------------|
| cinder_catalog_info             | catalog_info               |
| cinder_endpoint_template        | endpoint_template          |
| os_region_name                  | os_region_name             |
| cinder_ca_certificates_file     | ca_certificates_file       |
| cinder_http_retries             | http_retries               |
| cinder_http_timeout             | http_timeout               |
| cinder_api_insecure             | api_insecure               |
| cinder_cross_az_attach          | cross_az_attach            |
+---------------------------------+----------------------------+

UpgradeImpact
The changes are backward compatible.

Change-Id: Ie6b3f9d60b5e149375ff3039be444538f5f50756

commit_message:
Update apt_pre-download script

Refactor apt_pre-download script to classify the packages as per the
services and nodes for better debugging. This change makes it much
more convinent to go through the apt_pre-download.sh for adding,
debugging the issues.

Change-Id: I49f16953805a5895b813abfda2a33775c54236fc

commit_message:
Squash Icehouse DB Migrations

MySQL: Produces an identical database, with one bug fixed in migration 40.
SQLite: Produces a "better" database, with some lost constraints restored.
PostgreSQL: Produces an identical database, with a bug in migration 39 fixed.

Change-Id: I8c8397ad38cc2d6344aa169c766e3adf18043ee1

The recent merge of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/115025/ broke the
release of network segments to allocation pools on network delete,
resulting in network creates eventually failing with
NoNetworkAvailable exceptions. The network_delete() code is rearranged
to properly release the network segments, and a unit test is updated
to verify that the type drivers' release_segment() method is called.

Change-Id: Ica5f11b2012dedfcc097f34f1515f5f3ca208fd2

commit_message:
ML2: Fix release of network segments to allocation pools

The recent merge of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/115025/ broke the
release of network segments to allocation pools on network delete,
resulting in network creates eventually failing with
NoNetworkAvailable exceptions. The network_delete() code is rearranged
to properly release the network segments, and a unit test is updated
to verify that the type drivers' release_segment() method is called.

Partially implements: Blueprint ml2-type-driver-refactor

Change-Id: Ica5f11b2012dedfcc097f34f1515f5f3ca208fd2

commit_message:
report missing containers as deleted

The docker plugin will fail to delete a container resource if the
specified container is missing:

    APIError: 404 Client Error: Not Found ("No such container: None")

This patch modifies check_delete_complete to return 'true' if the docker
module raises an error for a 404 response from Docker.

closes-bug: #1364017
Change-Id: I33373ea0c010a5809454a5065e13c724731a21ce

commit_message:
Add openstack_version_prev key to deployment info

We should send to Astute information about previous openstack versions,
since it's needed by our puppet manifests.

Closes-Bug: #1364343

commit_message:
add ceph-extras and fast-cgi repositories.

adds ceph-extras and mod_fastcgi repositories, with newer versions for
required dependencies.

both off by default. includes rspec and rspec system tests.

commit_message:
Add boot_device support for vbox

In the Ironic ssh driver,
command set of 'set_boot_device' and 'get_boot_device' were not implemented
on VirualBox. This fixes it.

Change-Id: Icd19c7d1b5c11109cb6b400e99a6e7f2baa73d22
Closes-Bug: #1360017
